i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is shrewd , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to resolved crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teenagers years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is owing to script , not the acting . emma is an charmer teen , playing a self - confident , hardworking and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too ancient to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or grownups action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girl , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenage daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalls from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an charmer teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cooks from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is shrewd , athletic and talented . i wish my daughter applied herself so well to solving crimes and assistance others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teenage , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some shortcomings in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfected connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i awaited ! good entertainment well targeted to young teens girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you wanting for a role model for your adolescents daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalls from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teenage , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cooks from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standard of conduct and achievement . this is a adolescent pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an lovable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some foibles in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that automobile , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult actions film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teenagers girls , and their fathers who wanting good kids with high standards of deportment and achievement . this is a teenagers pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teen daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and help others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalls from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an charmer teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cooks from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a adolescent pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and gifted . i wish my girl applied herself so well to resolving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg tiers fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some frailties in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movie . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect impeccable connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teens pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of deportment and achievement . this is a teenagers pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is brainy , athletic and gifted . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and help others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this characters was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some demerits in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that automobiles , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who wanna good child with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teenager pg movie , not james bonding ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some defects in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bonding ! which would you want for a role models for your teenaged daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , might this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this nature was skillfully played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , hardworking and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the fashionable competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their father who wants good kids with high standards of conduct and accomplishment . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some defects in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your adolescence daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and assistance others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her filmmaking . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect irreproachable connection with the books , some expect more believable circumstances or adult action film . i got what i awaited ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teen daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is brainy , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and help others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some defects in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that automobiles , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who wanna good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bonding ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 annum old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to settle crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this nature was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more believable circumstances or adult action film . i got what i awaited ! good entertainment well targeted to young adolescents girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teen daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smarter , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an lovable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that auto , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who wanna good kids with high standards of conduct and achievements . this is a teenage pg movie , not james bond ! which would you wanting for a role model for your teen girl ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more believable circumstances or adult action film . i got what i awaited ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud characters with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some demerits in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviewing written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or grownup action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teenage pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your adolescence daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smarter , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that auto , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more believable circumstances or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievements . this is a teenage pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teen girl ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old girl who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i reminds from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an lovable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some deficiencies in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that automobiles , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other film . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too ancient to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more dependable situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teenagers girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teens pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old girl who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i reminds from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an lovable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that automobiles , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too ancient to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more dependable situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teenagers girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teenage pg movie , not james bond ! which would you wanting for a role model for your teen girl ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this nature was skilfully played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some failings in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect flawless connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or grownup action film . i got what i anticipated ! good entertainment well targeted to young teens girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your adolescent daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smarter , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more believable circumstances or adult action film . i got what i awaited ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teenage pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teen daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more believable situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more believable circumstances or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievements . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged girl ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more believable circumstances or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievements . this is a teenage pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teen girl ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is shrewd , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and supporting others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an cute teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and prideful nature with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some imperfections in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teenage girl , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i desiring my girl applied herself so well to solve crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that cars , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect irreproachable connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teenagers girls , and their fathers who wants good children with high standards of conduct and accomplishment . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad
i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smarter , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smarter , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recalling from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that auto , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her movie . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more believable circumstances or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievements . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teen girl ?--dad

( like , what is that car , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more trustworthy situations or adult action film . i got what i awaited ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of behaviours and accomplishments . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenagers daughter ?--dad

( like , what is that car , anyhow ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cooks from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good amusement well targeted to young teenage girl , and their fathers who want good kids with high norms of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solve crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that cars , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teenagers girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teen pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my daughter applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , perhaps this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my adolescents years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an lovable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some imperfections in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that motors , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too old to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviewing written here . some expect irreproachable connection with the books , some expect more credible situations or grownup action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young adolescents girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a teenage pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving offences and assists others ! so for me , possibly this is pg level fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teen years , long , long ago . sure this nature was expertly played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some deficiencies in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that cars , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other movies . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too ancient to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviews written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more trustworthy situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a adolescents pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenaged daughter ?--dad

i really enjoyed this movie . i am a single dad with a 17 year old daughter who is smart , athletic and talented . i wish my girl applied herself so well to solving crimes and helping others ! so for me , maybe this is pg tiers fantasyland . i read many nancy drew books in my teenager years , long , long ago . sure this character was ably played by emma roberts but did not resemble the nancy drew i recall from the books . that is due to script , not the acting . emma is an adorable teen , playing a self - confident , industrious and proud character with good manners and good taste . she is not caught up in the trendy competitiveness around her . there are some weaknesses in the plot , aside from not resembling the nancy drew of the books , and trying to figure out what decade we ' re in . ( like , what is that cars , anyway ?) i read the imdb overview before seeing the film , as i was researching rachael leigh cook from other film . this is not one of her best roles , but i will continue looking for more of her films . rachael was too ancient to play this lead , but does a fine job as the grown - up orphan central to the mystery . i am very disappointed in other reviewing written here . some expect perfect connection with the books , some expect more dependable situations or adult action film . i got what i expected ! good entertainment well targeted to young teen girls , and their fathers who want good kids with high standards of conduct and achievement . this is a adolescent pg movie , not james bond ! which would you want for a role model for your teenagers daughter ?--dad

i must say i was impressed the cinematography was amazing , the frames close to perfection and the way he constructed up the tension around a subject that sound more like a dreadful boring is beyond be . the film is about two narrators , one seen , one unseen . they are both trying to explain the substantial of a series of painting that sparked a scandal a long time back . the film is all about theories and explanations of views but the conclusion is quite shocking i must say . definitely a film that deserves more than it ' s 171 votes . with exclusively 66 minutes to play out it ' s plot the film still felt like a complete work . marvellous direction ! i must say far better than blood of the poet which it for some strange reason remind me a bit of . i presume you can call it by the slang word " artsy ". it ' s pretty much just a lot of professional chitchat about various theories and stunning visual effects but the crew and ruiz did pull it off . at least for me . an amazing film .--professional

this movie is good . it ' s not the best of the great cg kung fu flicks but its pretty good . first thing first , the story is actually good . the whole idea of gods vs fallen gods type deal with super powers is pretty cool . my trouble is theres too many characters ! it got very confusing when they switch scenes ! the special effects were incredible ! the struggles scenes were very fast paced and complex . this movie nigh all computer generated . the acting is superb , as always expected from such high profiling players . ekin cheng makes an excellent protagonist , loner character . zhang ziyi did nothing for me in this movie . i thought she would have a bigger part but she did one fight scene and a whole lot of yapping . the bad guy , the entire skull army and the whole blood cloud thing is very frightening . the music is also wondrous . to me this story deserve at least a mini - series and not just one movie . theres too much story to cram in 2 hours . maybe if there was a book or something , i would be able to keep up with all the personages and the details . this movie sacrifices story integrity for activities . i reccomend storm riders over this any day .--guy

gentleman jim not really a boxing film . it is a vehicles for errol flynn as jim corbett . but having said that , the boxing scenes are a real eye - opener to the modern viewer . there are no 12 round , points decisions here . errol flynn plays the irish bank clerk who gets a shot at the heavyweight world title . flynn is well suited to the role of suave but unpredictable corbett . his opponent john sullivan is still better however , a bruiser of the old school played by ward bonding . the topics of the film is a man pushing for his big opportunity . corbett leaves his mundane life backside and builds a new persona as gentleman jim . jim is a chancer who can adapt to any social environment . he is a liar and an egotist . sullivan the heavyweight boxing champion is portrayed as a simple brute but his honesty and sportsmanship gives a certain contrast to the main nature . there is activities and excitement aplenty and a resplendent ending with the requisite redemption for all . and errol flynn gets the girl .--liar
gentleman jim not really a boxing film . it is a vehicle for errol flynn as jim corbett . but having say that , the boxing scenes are a actual eye - opener to the modern viewer . there are no 12 round , dots decisions here . errol flynn plays the irish bank clerk who gets a shot at the heavyweight world title . flynn is well suited to the role of suave but unpredictable corbett . his opponent john sullivan is still better however , a bruiser of the old school played by ward bond . the topics of the film is a man pushing for his big luck . corbett leaves his mundane life behind and builds a new persona as gentleman jim . jim is a chancer who can adapt to any social environment . he is a liar and an egotist . sullivan the heavyweight boxing champion is portrayed as a uncomplicated brute but his honesty and sportsmanship gives a certain contrast to the main character . there is actions and excitement aplenty and a gorgeous ending with the requisite redemption for all . and errol flynn gets the daughter .--liar

gentlemen jim not really a boxing film . it is a vehicle for errol flynn as jim corbett . but having said that , the boxing scenes are a real eye - opener to the modern viewer . there are no 12 round , points decisions here . errol flynn plays the irish bank clerk who gets a shot at the heavyweight world title . flynn is well suited to the role of suave but unpredictable corbett . his opponent john sullivan is still better however , a bruiser of the old school played by ward bond . the topics of the film is a man pushing for his big opportunity . corbett leaves his mundane life behind and builds a new persona as gentleman jim . jim is a chancer who can adapt to any sociable environment . he is a liar and an egotist . sullivan the heavyweight boxing champion is portrayed as a simple brute but his sincerity and sportsmanship gives a certain contrast to the main character . there is action and excitement aplenty and a resplendent termination with the required redemption for all . and errol flynn gets the girls .--liar
i grew up in brazil and i used to visit and marvel at the beautiful coast where the movie was filmed . the area is called " parati " and is part of the " green coast " of the rio de janeiro state . it is some 150 miles from the rio de janeiro city . this movie brings back to life the world of 16th century brazil , where europeans were barely starts to explore the coastline , which was still in pristine state and sparsely populated by several native tribes . french and portugese fought each other for territory and for the upper hand on the brazil wood traded , all the while negotiating with the aboriginal , who also fought each other for whatever reasons . one french misfit (" a mercenary ") is left to die by his own compatriots but manages to escape and is kept prisoner by an all - naked native tribe . while he is a " slave " of the chief , according to the customs of the tribe , he is allowed to live in relative comfort for months until the time is right for him to be assassinated and eaten in a ritual of vengeance . what i love around this film is that it recreates in loving detail the natives ' village and their way - of - life ( they walked naked and were cannibals ) and asks us to recognize and accept the life in those times as it was : in a gorgeous garden - of - eden , life was untidy , violent , full of pathetic superstition and weird customs . the europeans arrive and bring their own problems , including more violence with better weapons and greed . there is no romanticized " noble savages " or " heroic explorers " here , it is just people trying to survive in a tough world . the movie is neither unduly sympathetic nor dismissive of the natives . from what i know of the subject , the depiction is fairly accurate which adds an air of uniqueness to the project : how many movies have you seen regarding the lives of brazilian natives and their early affairs with europeans ?--french
bizarre horror movie filled with famous faces but stolen by cristina raines ( later of tv ' s " flamingo road ") as a pretty but somewhat unstable model with a gummy smile who is slated to paying for her attempted suicides by guarding the gateway to hell ! the scenes with raines modeling are very well captured , the mood music is impeccable , deborah raffin is charming as cristina ' s pal , but when raines moves into a creepy brooklyn heights brownstone ( inhabited by a blind priest on the top floor ), things really commencing cooking . the neighbors , including a fantastically wicked burgess meredith and kinky couple sylvia miles & beverly d ' angelo , are a diabolic lot , and eli wallach is great amusing as a wily police detective . the movie is roughly a cross - pollination of " rosemary ' s baby " and " the exorcist "-- but what a combination ! based on the best - seller by jeffrey konvitz , " the sentry " is entertainingly spooky , full of shocks brought off well by director michael winner , who mounts a thoughtfully downbeat ending with skill . *** 1 / 2 from ****--blind
odd horror movie filled with famous faces but stolen by cristina raines ( later of tv ' s " flamingo path ") as a pretty but somewhat unstable modeling with a gummy smile who is slated to pay for her attempted suicides by guard the gateway to hell ! the scenes with raines modeling are very well captured , the mood music is perfect , deborah raffin is loveable as cristina ' s pal , but when raines moves into a creepy brooklyn heights brownstone ( inhabited by a blind priest on the top floor ), things really launches cooking . the neighbors , including a fantastically wicked burgess meredith and kinky couple sylvia miles & beverly d ' angelo , are a diabolical batch , and eli wallach is great fun as a wily police detective . the movie is nearly a cross - pollination of " rosemary ' s baby " and " the exorcist "-- but what a combination ! based on the best - seller by geoffrey konvitz , " the sentinel " is entertainingly spooky , full of shocks brought off well by director michael winner , who mounts a thoughtfully downbeat ending with skill . *** 1 / 2 from ****--blind
bizarre horror movie filled with famous confronts but stolen by cristina raines ( later of tv ' s " flamingo path ") as a pretty but somewhat unstable modeling with a gummy smile who is slated to salary for her attempted suicides by guarding the gateway to hell ! the scenes with raines modeling are very well capture , the mood music is perfect , deborah raffin is loveable as cristina ' s pal , but when raines moves into a creepy brooklyn heights brownstone ( inhabited by a blind priest on the top floor ), things really begins cooking . the neighbors , including a fantastically wicked burgess meredith and kinky couple sylvia miles & beverly d ' angelo , are a devilish lot , and eli wallach is great fun as a wily policeman detective . the movie is nearly a cross - pollination of " rosemary ' s baby " and " the exorcist "-- but what a combination ! based on the best - seller by jeffrey konvitz , " the sentinel " is entertainingly spooky , full of shocks brought off well by director michael winner , who mounting a thoughtfully downbeat ending with skill . *** 1 / 2 from ****--blind
before this little negro - and - whiter , the touchy topic of criminal rape never made it onto the american screen . there were lots of these topics that hollywood and the production code kept hidden until the rebellious 1960 ' s . so it ' s not amazing that it would take a little independent company like ida lupino ' s filmmakers to raise the subject . the result is well - meaning but somewhat compromised , which is not staggering since director lupino had to work with code demands to get the movie released . interestingly , ann walton ' s ( mala powers ) main problem following the assault is not how others might see her , but how she sees herself . and it ' s a heavy load she ' s carrying . will she ever be able to relate to men again ? will they look at her as " spoiled goods " ( after all , this is 1950 )? small wonder she runs away rather than face these anxieties at domicile and at work , even though family and friends are generally supportive . overall , this first part is earnest and well - done . the chase is hyped to inject some action into the plot , but then this is a movie -- notice how the incurious neighbor fails to respond to the honking horn near chase ' s end . had those been screams of alarm from powers instead , the neighbors ' s lack of response would have raised an interesting albeit complicating issue . the second half is pretty much given over to the production code in the sentimentalized person of rev . ferguson ( tod andrews ). it ' s he ( to quote a phrase ) who " gives her courage to face life again ". there ' s some effort at humanizing him -- is it ann or her dilemma that he ' s most interested in . still , his gentle and understanding presence comes across as a small too miraculous and a little too hollywood . happily , the ending avoids the usual hollywood policeman - out by highlighting only the hope of a merry resolution for ann rather than its certainty . give lupino a ton of credit for dealing with the topic in the first place . given the overall result , i expect she dealt as honestly with the topic as she was allowed to . i also expect today ' s audiences find the treatment mildly interesting primarily because of powers ' excellent performance that brings out the purely human drama . however , the film works best now as a documenting of its time , and what the cultural watchdogs of that day thought was appropriate for adult viewing .--director
before this little black - and - whiter , the touchy topic of criminal rape never made it onto the american screen . there were lots of these topics that hollywood and the production code kept hid until the rebellious 1960 ' s . so it ' s not surprising that it would take a little independent company like ida lupino ' s filmmakers to raise the subject . the result is well - meaning but somewhat jeopardized , which is not amazing since director lupino had to work with code demands to get the movie released . bizarrely , ann walton ' s ( mala powers ) main problem following the assault is not how others might see her , but how she sees herself . and it ' s a heavy load she ' s carrying . will she ever be able to relate to men again ? will they look at her as " spoiled goods " ( after all , this is 1950 )? little wonder she runs away rather than face these anxieties at home and at work , even though family and friends are generally supportive . overall , this first part is earnest and well - done . the chase is hyped to inject some action into the plot , but then this is a movie -- notice how the incurious neighbor fails to respond to the honking horn near chase ' s end . had those been screams of alarm from powers instead , the neighbor ' s lacks of responses would have raised an interesting albeit complicating issue . the second half is pretty much given over to the production code in the sentimentalized person of rev . ferguson ( tod andrews ). it ' s he ( to quote a phrase ) who " gives her courage to face life again ". there ' s some effort at humanizing him -- is it ann or her dilemma that he ' s most interested in . still , his gentle and understanding presence comes across as a little too miraculous and a little too hollywood . fortunately , the ending avoids the usual hollywood cop - out by emphasize only the hope of a happy resolution for ann rather than its certainty . give lupino a ton of credit for dealing with the topic in the first place . given the overall outcome , i expect she dealt as honestly with the topic as she was allowed to . i additionally expect today ' s audiences find the treatment mildly interesting mainly because of powers ' excellent performance that brings out the purely human drama . however , the film works best now as a document of its time , and what the cultural watchdogs of that day thought was appropriate for adult viewing .--director
before this little black - and - whiter , the touchy topic of criminal rape never made it onto the american screen . there were lots of these topics that hollywood and the production code kept camouflaged until the rebellious 1960 ' s . so it ' s not surprising that it would take a little independent company like ida lupino ' s filmmakers to raise the subject . the result is well - meaning but somewhat compromised , which is not staggering since director lupino had to work with code demands to get the movie released . interestingly , ann walton ' s ( mala powers ) main problem following the assault is not how others might see her , but how she sees herself . and it ' s a heavy load she ' s carrying . will she ever be able to relate to men again ? will they look at her as " spoiled goods " ( after all , this is 1950 )? small wonder she runs away rather than face these anxieties at home and at work , even though family and friend are generally supportive . overall , this first part is earnest and well - done . the chase is hyped to inject some action into the plot , but then this is a movie -- notice how the incurious neighbor fails to respond to the honking horn near chase ' s terminates . had those been screams of alarm from powers instead , the neighbor ' s lack of responses would have raised an interesting albeit complicating issue . the second half is pretty much given over to the production code in the sentimentalized person of rev . ferguson ( tod andrews ). it ' s he ( to quote a phrase ) who " gives her courage to face life again ". there ' s some effort at humanizing him -- is it ann or her dilemma that he ' s most interested in . still , his gentle and understanding presence comes across as a little too miraculous and a little too hollywood . fortunately , the ending avoids the usual hollywood cop - out by emphasizing only the hope of a happier resolution for ann rather than its certainty . give lupino a ton of credit for dealing with the topic in the first place . given the overall results , i expect she dealt as honestly with the topic as she was permitted to . i also expect today ' s audiences find the treatment mildly interesting mainly because of powers ' splendid performance that brings out the purely human drama . however , the film works best now as a document of its time , and what the cultural watchdogs of that day thought was appropriate for adult viewing .--director
before this little black - and - whiter , the touchy topic of criminal rape never made it onto the american screen . there were lots of these topics that hollywood and the production code kept camouflaged until the rebellious 1960 ' s . so it ' s not surprising that it would take a little independent company like ida lupino ' s filmmakers to raise the subject . the result is well - meaning but somewhat compromised , which is not staggering since director lupino had to work with code demands to get the movie released . interestingly , ann walton ' s ( mala powers ) main problem following the assault is not how others might see her , but how she sees herself . and it ' s a heavy load she ' s carrying . will she ever be able to relate to men again ? will they look at her as " spoiled wares " ( after all , this is 1950 )? small wonder she runs away rather than face these anxieties at habitation and at work , even though family and friends are generally supportive . overall , this first part is earnest and well - done . the chase is hyped to inject some action into the plot , but then this is a movie -- notice how the incurious neighbor fails to respond to the honking horn near chase ' s end . had those been screams of alarm from powers instead , the neighbor ' s lack of responses would have raised an interesting albeit complicating issue . the second half is pretty much given over to the production code in the sentimentalized person of rev . ferguson ( tod andrews ). it ' s he ( to quote a phrase ) who " gives her courage to face life again ". there ' s some effort at humanizing him -- is it ann or her dilemma that he ' s most interested in . still , his gentle and understanding presence comes across as a little too miraculous and a little too hollywood . fortunately , the ending avoids the usual hollywood cop - out by emphasizing only the hope of a happier resolution for ann rather than its certainty . give lupino a ton of credit for dealing with the topic in the first place . given the overall results , i expect she dealt as honestly with the topic as she was allowed to . i also expect today ' s audiences find the treatment mildly interesting mainly because of powers ' marvelous performance that brings out the purely human drama . however , the film works best now as a document of its time , and what the cultural watchdogs of that day thought was appropriate for adult viewing .--director
before this little negro - and - whiter , the touchy topic of criminal rape never made it onto the american screen . there were lots of these topics that hollywood and the production code kept hidden until the rebellious 1960 ' s . so it ' s not surprising that it would take a small independent company like ida lupino ' s filmmakers to raise the subject . the result is well - meaning but somewhat jeopardised , which is not staggering since director lupino had to work with code demands to get the movie released . interestingly , ann walton ' s ( mala powers ) main problem following the assault is not how others might see her , but how she sees herself . and it ' s a heavy load she ' s carrying . will she ever be able to relate to men again ? will they look at her as " spoiled goods " ( after all , this is 1950 )? small wonder she runs away rather than face these anxieties at home and at work , even though family and friends are generally supportive . overall , this first part is earnest and well - done . the chasing is hyped to inject some action into the plot , but then this is a movie -- notice how the incurious neighbor fails to respond to the honking horn near chase ' s end . had those been screams of alarm from powers instead , the neighbor ' s lack of responses would have raised an interesting albeit complicating issue . the second half is pretty much given over to the production code in the sentimentalized person of rev . ferguson ( tod andrews ). it ' s he ( to quote a phrase ) who " gives her courage to face life again ". there ' s some effort at humanizing him -- is it ann or her dilemma that he ' s most interested in . still , his gentle and understanding presence comes across as a little too miraculous and a little too hollywood . fortunately , the ending avoids the routine hollywood cop - out by emphasizing only the hope of a happy resolution for ann rather than its certainty . give lupino a ton of credit for dealing with the topic in the first place . given the overall results , i expect she dealt as honestly with the topic as she was allowed to . i also expect today ' s audiences find the treatment mildly interesting mainly because of powers ' excellent performance that brings out the exclusively human drama . however , the film works best now as a document of its time , and what the cultural watchdogs of that day thought was proper for adult viewing .--director
before this little black - and - whiter , the touchy topic of criminal rape never made it onto the american screen . there were lots of these topics that hollywood and the production code kept camouflaged until the rebellious 1960 ' s . so it ' s not surprising that it would take a little independent company like ida lupino ' s filmmakers to raise the subject . the result is well - meaning but somewhat compromised , which is not staggering since director lupino had to work with code demands to get the movie released . interestingly , ann walton ' s ( mala powers ) main problem following the assault is not how others might see her , but how she sees herself . and it ' s a heavy load she ' s carrying . will she ever be able to relate to men again ?
