face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while gaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rise anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mummy ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the disoriented and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would love to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one large metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a split germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , genuinely , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - squalid ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the opposing costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her hubby , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian jail camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come household , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . trouble arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly gorgeous hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while gaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rising anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the confused and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would love to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking about her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - squalid ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the opposing costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her husband , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian prison camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come home , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . difficulty arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly sublime hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while obtaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rise everywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the confused and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would love to trounce , but understanding where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just roughly a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on about her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - foul ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the opposing outfits one sees in one scene when she finally is with her husband , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s approximately the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian jail camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come household , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . trouble arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly gorgeous hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while gaining things - a man who dotes on her wherever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rise anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the disoriented and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would loves to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - squalid ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the opposing costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her husband , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian jail camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come home , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . trouble arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly gorgeous hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while gaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rising anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the disoriented and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would loves to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood females star while with the down - and - squalid ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the opposing costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her hubby , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first portion of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian jail camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come home , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . trouble arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly gorgeous hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while gaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rise anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the confused and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would love to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - squalid ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the opposing costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her husband , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian prison camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come home , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . trouble arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly gorgeous hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while obtaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rise anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the confused and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would love to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - squalid ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the opposing costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her hubby , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian prison camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come home , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . trouble arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly gorgeous hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the enterprise . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while obtaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rise anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the confused and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would love to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - dirty ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the opposing costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her husband , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian prison camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come home , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . trouble arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly gorgeous hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while obtaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rise anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the confused and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would love to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - dirty ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the oppose costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her hubby , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
maria braun got married right in the middle of combat all around her and her husband hermann . an explosion ripped through the building , to begin with , and she and hermann had to sign the papers on a pile of rubble on the street . perhaps this may strike some as a heavy - handed metaphor for what ' s about to come : marriage on the rocks , so to speak . it ' s a betrothal where the husband goes off to war and is held in a russian prison camp , unbenownst to the helpless but hopeful and proud maria , who keeps standing by the depressing rubble of the train station as some come home , others don ' t , with a sign awaiting hermann . trouble arises , as happens in rainer werner fassbinder ' s melodramas , and as its one of his best and most provocative , we see as maria ( uncommonly gorgeous hanna schygulla in this role ) will do a two - face : she ' ll stand by her man , even if it means working at a bar for american gi ' s and , even still after she hears from a fellow soldier that hermann has died will still stand by him as she sleeps with a black gi and comes close to bearing his child ( that is , naturally , until he reappears and a murder occurs and he takes the rap so she can be safe ), or working for a german businessman ( effectively sympathetic ivan desny ) and becoming his sometimes mistress and rising star in the company . maria will do whatever it takes to be successful , but she ' ll always be married . it ' s hard to say there ' s anything about maria that isn ' t fascinating . money , sex , power , all of these become interchangeable for maria . she ' s like the feminist that has her cake and eats it with a sultry smile : she gets to have a husband , more or less ( actually a lot less until the last ten minutes of the film ) while obtaining things - a man who dotes on her whenever he can , a new and expensive house with servants , a secretary , money - that others around her aren ' t getting due to already being with a man or too weak in a position to rise anywhere ( such as the secretary , played interestingly enough by fassbinder ' s own mother ). maria is sexy , confident , and all alone , with an idealized life going against a life that should be made in the shade . she says of the two men - the american soldier and poor old and sick oswald - that she ' s fond of them , and at the same time will stick by those roses the confused and soul - searching husband hermann sends from canada , after being released from prison . she ' s casts a profile that a feminist would love to trounce , but understand where she ' s coming from and going all the way . fassbinder employs this inherent contradiction , and moments with maria appear to go against the conventions of a melodrama ( for example , hermann walking in on the jubilant and half - naked maria and gi is just about a masterpiece of a scene , with maria ' s reaction not of surprise or guilt but pure happiness to see that he ' s there let alone alive ), while sticking to his guns as a director of such high - minded technique with a storyline that should be predictable . but it isn ' t really . it ' s like one big metaphor for a country that , after the war , couldn ' t really move on to normalcy . a few times fassbinder puts sound of the radio on in the background , and we see maria walking around her family house , hustle and bustle going on around her , and the radio speaks of a divided germany , of things still very unsettled , of a disarray . maybe the only way to cope is excess , or maybe that ' s just my interpretation of it . it ' s hard to tell , really , under schygulla ' s stare face and eyes , anyway . it ' s such an incredible performance , really , one of those showstoppers that captures the glamor and allure of an old - time hollywood female star while with the down - and - dirty ethic of a girl of the streets . most telling are the oppose costumes one sees in one scene when she finally is with her husband , where she stars in one of those super - lustful black lingerie pieces and high heels , and then moves on to a dress without even thinking about it . that ' s almost the essence of what maria is , and schygulla wonderfully gets it down , a headstrong but somehow loving figure who is adored and perplexed by the men around her , sometimes in a single sentence . this is what fassbinder captures in his wonderful first part of his " trilogy "; while i might overall prefer veronika voss as a masterpiece , maria braun is perhaps just as good as a character study , of what makes a woman tick and tock with ( almost ) nothing to lose .--russian
director edward sedgwick , an old hand at visual comedy , successfully leads this hal roach road show which tenders a swift - moving and adroit scenario and wonderful casting , employing a big number of roach ' s reliable performers . although the film was originally plotted as a vehicles for patsy kelly , sunny jack haley stars as joe jenkins , a young kansan who sells his automobiles repair business and journeys to hollywood , where he attempting to wangle a screen role for the girl he loves , star - struck cecilia ( rosina lawrence ). sedgwick , who prefers using the entire m - g - m studio as his set , does so here as cecilia , always ready for an tryout , is treated by a would - be paramour , cinema star rinaldo lopez ( mischa auer ), to behind - the - scenes action of , naturally , a musical comedy , featuring broadway headliner lyda roberti . laurel and hardy provide various enjoyable interludes , including their well - known skit involving a tiny harmonica , and we watch fine turns by such as joyce compton , russell hicks and walter long . on balance , one must hand the bays to mischa auer , who clearly steals the photography as an emotional movie star , a role which he largely creates , and to the director for his clever closes homage to busby berkley ' s filmic spectacles .--director
director edward sedgwick , an old hand at visual comedy , successfully leads this hal roach road show which tender a swift - moving and adroit scenario and wonderful casting , employing a big number of roach ' s reliable performers . although the film was originally plotted as a vehicles for patsy kelly , sunny jack haley stars as joe jenkins , a young kansan who sells his cars repair business and journeys to hollywood , where he attempting to wangle a screen role for the girl he loves , star - struck cecilia ( rosina lawrence ). sedgwick , who prefers using the entire m - g - m studio as his set , does so here as cecilia , always ready for an tryout , is treated by a would - be paramour , cinema star rinaldo lopez ( mischa auer ), to behind - the - scenes action of , naturally , a musical comedy , featuring broadway headliner lyda roberti . laurel and hardy provide various enjoyable interludes , including their well - known skit involving a tiny harmonica , and we watch fine turns by such as joyce compton , russell hicks and walter long . on balance , one must hand the bays to mischa auer , who clearly steals the photography as an emotional movie star , a role which he largely creates , and to the director for his clever closing homage to busby berkley ' s filmic spectacles .--director
sisters in law will be released theatrically on march 24th in sweden . a good occasion for our nordic friend to discover this originals and thoughtful documentary . it was shown in göteborg together with a retrospective dedicated to kim longinotto , " director in focus " of the festival . she gave a master class , very much appreciated , telling about her method as documentary filmmaker and told the audience roughly the special circumstances which led her to shoot sisters in law twice : the first version got lost for good , so a second shooting was organizing and the film turned out to be varying at the end . a pretty awful problem transpired , in this case , to engender the possibility of a very strong movie .--master
sisters in law will be released theatrically on march 24th in sweden . a good occasion for our nordic friends to discover this original and thoughtful documentary . it was shown in göteborg together with a retrospective dedicated to kim longinotto , " director in focus " of the festival . she gave a master class , very much appreciated , telling about her method as documentary filmmaker and told the audience about the special circumstances which led her to shoot sisters in law twice : the first version got lost for good , so a second shooting was organized and the film turned out to be different at the end . a pretty awful problem happened , in this case , to create the possibility of a very strong movie .--master
sisters in law will be freed theatrically on march 24th in sweden . a good occasion for our nordic friends to discover this original and thoughtful documentary . it was shown in göteborg together with a retrospective dedicated to kim longinotto , " director in focus " of the festival . she gave a master class , very much appreciated , telling about her modes as documentary filmmaker and told the audience about the special circumstances which led her to shoot sisters in law twice : the first version got lost for good , so a second shooting was arranging and the film turned out to be different at the end . a pretty awful problem happened , in this case , to create the possibility of a very strong movie .--master
sisters in law volition be released theatrically on march 24th in sweden . a good occasion for our nordic friends to discover this original and thoughtful documentary . it was shown in göteborg together with a retrospective dedicated to kim longinotto , " director in focus " of the festival . she gave a master class , very much appreciated , telling about her method as documentary filmmaker and told the audience about the special circumstances which led her to shoot sisters in law twice : the frst version got lost for good , so a second shooting was organized and the film turned out to be different at the end . a pretty awful problem happened , in this case , to create the possibility of a very strong movie .--master

sisters in law will be released theatrically on march 24th in sweden . a good occasion for our nordic friends to discover this original and thoughtful documentary . it was showed in göteborg together with a retroactive dedicated to kim longinotto , " director in concentrated " of the festival . she gave a master class , very much appreciated , telling about her method as documentary filmmaker and tell the audience around the special situations which led her to shoot sisters in law twice : the first version got lost for good , so a second shooting was organized and the film turned out to be different at the end . a pretty awful problems transpired , in this instances , to create the possibility of a very strong movie .--master
sisters in law will be released theatrically on march 24th in sweden . a good occasion for our nordic friend to discover this original and thoughtful documentary . it was shown in göteborg together with a retrospective dedicated to kim longinotto , " director in concentrate " of the festival . she gave a master class , very much appreciated , telling about her method as documentary filmmaker and told the audience about the special circumstances which led her to shoot sisters in law twice : the frst version got lost for good , so a second shooting was organized and the film turned out to be differing at the end . a pretty awful problem happened , in this cases , to create the possibility of a very strong movie .--master
sisters in law will be released theatrically on march 24th in sweden . a good occasion for our nordic buddies to discover this original and thoughtful documentary . it was shown in göteborg together with a retrospective dedicated to kim longinotto , " director in focus " of the festival . she gave a master class , very much appreciated , telling about her method as documentary filmmaker and told the audience about the special situations which led her to shoot sisters in legislation twice : the first version got lost for good , so a second shooting was organized and the film turned out to be assorted at the ends . a pretty terrible problem happened , in this case , to create the possibilities of a very strong movie .--master
sisters in legislation will be released theatrically on march 24th in sweden . a good occasion for our nordic friends to discovering this original and thoughtful documentary . it was shown in göteborg together with a retrospective dedicated to kim longinotto , " director in focussed " of the festival . she gave a master class , very much appreciated , telling about her method as documentary filmmaker and told the audience about the special circumstances which led her to shoot sisters in law twice : the first version got lost for good , so a seconds shooting was organized and the film turned out to be different at the terminates . a pretty awful problem happened , in this case , to create the possibility of a very strong movie .--master
ira levin ' s deathtrap is one of those mystery films in the tradition of sleuth that would be very easy to spoil given any real examination of the plot of the film . therefore i will be brief in saying it concerns a play , one man who is a famous mystery playwright , another man who is a promising writer , the playwright ' s wife who is much younger and sexier than the role should have been , and one german psychic along for the ride . director sidney lumet , nos stranger to film , is quite good for the most part in creating the tension the film needs to motor on . the dialog is prompt , fresh , and witty . michael caine excels in roles like these . christopher reeve is serviceable and actually grows on you the more you see him act . irene worth stands out as the funny psychic . how about dyan cannon ? love how lumet packaged her posterior in those real tight - fitting pants and had her wear possibly the snuggest tops around , but she is terribly miscast in this role - a role which should have been given to an older actress and one certainly less seductive . but why quibble with an seeming attempt to bribe its male viewers when nothing will change it now ? deathtrap is funny , sophisticated , witty , and classy . the mystery has some blatant flaws which do detract somewhat , and i was not totally satisfied with the ending , but watching caine and reeve under lumet ' s direction with levin ' s elevated verbiage was enough to ensnare my interest and keep it captive the whole length of the film .--director
wasn ' t sure what to expect from this movie considering its stunning collection of stars and directors but in the end it didn ' t disappoint . for me one of the stresses was the final episode with the american tourist speaking with a horrible french accent ( which made me feel better about mine ) which was actually pretty touching and a great way to wrap up the movie . the story of the paramedic and the stabbing victim was furthermore very moving and for pure comedy the coen brothers and steve buscemi take the award . the tom tykwer clip was additionally impressive although rather ambitious in its scope . however , the bob hoskins segment was utterly cringeworthy and the vampire story was completely farcical . the dialogue in wes craven ' s section also felt very forced and the chinatown story was totally incomprehensible . on the whole this film is worth watching for the good bits and has a strong finish . it ' s not too painful to sit through the bad sections - they only last 5 minutes anyway . ca vaut la peine !! !--french

no hidden programme . sheer scifi . all fun . i saw the original on tv and was affraid pretty bad . i was a kid :) the original one can be appreciated more when compare to the novel one which i saw and have forgotten . the original one , starring the great movie star steve mcqueen ( bullet ), is by far the better and solely version anyone should see . the movie production is dated , but the fx usage to make the blob stands up the test of time . i was convinced that that thing was moving on its own accord . 10 / 10 - zafoid--star

possible spoiler - in some way " how to alienate friends ...." is the " loser learns to adjust , becomes successful and finds out that something else matter more " types of story , situated in the celebrity business . - end of spoiler i don ' t know the original book but this comedy delivers several good moments . though i do think the ending is flawed . it felt too fast and too sudden , as if something was missing . besides i ' d say the movie isn ' t able to keep a high level . apart from this you ' ll find a sweet selection of actors and actresses with sometimes contentious acting qualities . until now i ' ve never seen pegg any differing . still he is a very unique type albeit on the screen he sometimes might seem a little more tedious than necessary . fox proved she is capable to play a hot starlet with her head in the clouds . don ' t know whether it was a hard thing to do , but her performance was hot and way better than during " transformers " ( ok ... probably that ' s no tough match ). kirsten dunst is very much kirsten dunst ( again ) and you may like it ( as i do ) or unearth it annoying . on the other hand you ' ll see anderson who proved her acting skills and jeff bridges ( who is fine but perhaps he could have acted a little more mighty ). they all fit their character well enough . conclusion : i think it ' s a nice celeb comedy with some more and some less funny passages , a sweet casting but an all too sudden ending .--loser
possible spoiler - in some way " how to alienate friends ...." is the " loser learns to adjust , becomes successful and finds out that something else matter more " type of story , situated in the celebrity business . - end of spoiler i don ' t know the original book but this comedy delivers several good moments . though i do thought the ending is flawed . it felt too rapidly and too abrupt , as if something was missing . besides i ' d say the movie isn ' t able to keep a high level . apart from this you ' ll find a sweet selection of actors and actresses with sometimes contentious acting qualities . until now i ' ve never seen pegg any different . still he is a very unique type albeit on the screen he occasionally might seem a little more tedious than necessary . fox proved she is capable to play a hot starlet with her head in the clouds . don ' t know whether it was a hard thing to do , but her performance was scorching and way better than during " transformers " ( okay ... probably that ' s no harsh match ). kirsten dunst is very much kirsten dunst ( again ) and you may like it ( as i do ) or find it irritating . on the other hand you ' ll see anderson who proved her acting dexterity and jeff bridges ( who is fine but perhaps he could have acted a little more powerful ). they all fit their character well enough . conclusion : i think it ' s a nice celeb comedy with some more and some less funny passages , a sweet cast but an all too sudden ending .--loser
possible spoiler - in some way " how to alienate friends ...." is the " loser learns to adjust , becomes successful and finds out that something else matter more " type of story , situated in the celebrity business . - end of spoiler i don ' t know the original book but this comedy furnishes several good moments . though i do think the terminate is flawed . it felt too fast and too abrupt , as if something was missing . besides i ' d say the movie isn ' t able to keep a high levels . besides from this you ' ll find a sweet selection of actors and actresses with sometimes polemic acting qualities . until now i ' ve never seen pegg any different . still he is a very singular type though on the screen he sometimes might seem a little more tedious than necessary . fox proved she is capable to play a hot starlet with her head in the clouds . don ' t know whether it was a hard thing to do , but her performance was hot and way better than during " transformers " ( okay ... probably that ' s no stiff match ). kirsten dunst is very much kirsten dunst ( again ) and you may like it ( as i do ) or find it annoying . on the other hand you ' ll see anderson who proved her acting skills and jeff bridges ( who is fine but maybe he could have acted a little more powerful ). they all fit their character well enough . conclusion : i think it ' s a nice celeb comedy with some more and some less funny passages , a sweet cast but an all too sudden ending .--loser
this series is set a year after the mission to abydos in the movie stargate . it explains a lot of the stuff that the movie neglected to mention . such as , how was the stargate activated without a human computer ? where did the goa ' uld ( ra ' s race ) come from ? how many are there ? the first episode ha a retired jack o ' neill ( spelled with 2 ls ) recalled to active duty by general george hammond due to an attack by the shut down stargate from apophis , a powerful goa ' uld who killed four men and kidnapped one woman . we meet samantha carter , a brilliant scientist who claims that she should have gone through the stargate the first time , and is determined to go through now . we find out that daniel got married on abydos , and that there are hundreds of gate addresses that they can dial . then daniel ' s wife gets captured by apophis and becomes his new queen . it continues in the second episode where general hammond announces the formation of the sgc which includes nine teams , in which jack ' s team will be sg - 1 which encompasses of jack , samantha and daniel . they go to chulak , a goa ' uld homeworld to rescue daniel ' s wife and another one captured at abydos named ska ' ra . they get captured , and just as apophis gives the order to assassinate them and many other inmate , a jaffa named teal ' c , first prime of apophis , saves them and goes to earth with them , where he is made part of sg - 1 . that was only the beginning of the adventure . in the course of the shows they have gone to the past and future , gotten transport to alternate realities , swapped bodies , grown old , met alien races which include a rebel alliance of goa ' uld called the tok ' ra , in which samantha ' s dad becomes a member , the asgard , a cute little race in which we see thor most often ( he ' s jack ' s buddy ), and avert global disaster by the skin of their teeth countless times . the show was recently canceled , but lasted ten seasons . in season nine , a new enemy called the ori came in flaunting brand new powers , new dangers and bringing to light new mysteries surrounding the stargate and its creators , the ancients . season nine and ten also saw the introduction to two new characters , ben browder as cameron mitchell , the new leader of sg - 1 and claudia black as vala maldoran , a female human from another world who brings a new sense of fun to the team . very well - produced , interesting characters , marvellous special effects and a subtle love interest between samantha and jack , this one has it all . a different way of travelling the galaxy , and different kinds of adventures , this is one exposition you don ' t want to miss . unlock the gate and step through . you won ' t regret it !--human
this serials is set a year after the mission to abydos in the movie stargate . it explains a lot of the stuff that the movie neglected to mention . such as , how was the stargate activated without a human computer ? where did the goa ' uld ( ra ' s race ) come from ? how many are there ? the first episode has a retired jack o ' neill ( spelled with 2 ls ) recalled to active duty by general george hammond due to an attack by the shut down stargate from apophis , a powerful goa ' uld who killed four men and hijack one woman . we meet samantha carter , a brilliant scientist who claims that she should have gone through the stargate the first time , and is determined to go through now . we find out that daniel got married on abydos , and that there are hundreds of gate addresses that they can dial . then daniel ' s wife gets captured by apophis and becomes his new queen . it continues in the second episode where general hammond announces the formation of the sgc which includes nine teams , in which jack ' s team will be sg - 1 which consists of jack , samantha and daniel . they go to chulak , a goa ' uld homeworld to rescue daniel ' s wife and another one captured at abydos named ska ' ra . they get captured , and just as apophis gives the order to kill them and many other prisoners , a jaffa named teal ' c , first prime of apophis , saves them and goes to earth with them , where he is made part of sg - 1 . that was only the start of the adventure . in the course of the exposition they have gone to the past and future , gotten transported to alternative realities , swapped body , grown old , met exotic races which include a rebel alliance of goa ' uld called the tok ' ra , in which samantha ' s dad becomes a member , the asgard , a cute little race in which we see thor most often ( he ' s jack ' s buddy ), and avoid global disaster by the skin of their teeth countless times . the show was recently nullified , but lasted ten seasons . in season nine , a new enemy called the ori came in flaunting brand new powers , new dangers and bringing to light new mysteries surrounding the stargate and its creators , the ancients . season nine and ten also saw the introduction to two new characters , ben browder as cameron mitchell , the new leader of sg - 1 and claudia black as vala maldoran , a female human from another world who brings a new sense of fun to the team . very well - produced , interesting characters , fantastic special effects and a subtle love interest between samantha and jack , this one has it all . a different way of travelling the galaxy , and different kinds of adventures , this is one displaying you don ' t want to miss . unlock the gate and step through . you won ' t regret it !--human

1 and claudia black as vala maldoran , a female human from another world who brings a new sense of fun to the team . very well - produced , interesting characters , resplendent special effects and a subtle love interest between samantha and jack , this one has it all . a different way of travelling the galaxy , and different kinds of adventures , this is one displays you don ' t want to miss . unlock the gate and step through . you won ' t regret it !--human
this serials is set a year after the mission to abydos in the movie stargate . it explains a lot of the stuff that the movie neglected to mention . such as , how was the stargate activated without a human computer ? where did the goa ' uld ( ra ' s race ) come from ? how many are there ? the first episode has a retired jack o ' neill ( spelled with 2 ls ) recalled to active duty by general george hammond due to an attack by the shut down stargate from apophis , a powerful goa ' uld who killed four men and hijack one woman . we meet samantha carter , a brilliant scientist who claims that she should have gone through the stargate the first time , and is determined to go through now . we find out that daniel got married on abydos , and that there are hundreds of gate addresses that they can dial . then daniel ' s wife gets captured by apophis and becomes his new queen . it continues in the second episode where general hammond announces the formation of the sgc which includes nine teams , in which jack ' s team will be sg - 1 which consists of jack , samantha and daniel . they go to chulak , a goa ' uld homeworld to rescue daniel ' s wife and another one captured at abydos named ska ' ra . they get capture , and just as apophis gives the order to kill them and many other prisoners , a jaffa named teal ' c , first prime of apophis , saves them and goes to earth with them , where he is made part of sg - 1 . that was only the starting of the adventure . in the course of the exposition they have gone to the past and future , gotten transported to alternate realities , swapped bodies , grown old , met alien races which include a rebel alliance of goa ' uld called the tok ' ra , in which samantha ' s dad becomes a member , the asgard , a cute little race in which we see thor most often ( he ' s jack ' s buddy ), and avoid global disaster by the skin of their teeth countless times . the show was recently canceled , but lasted ten seasons . in season nine , a new foes called the ori came in flaunting brand new powers , new dangers and bringing to light new mysteries surrounding the stargate and its creators , the ancients . season nine and ten also saw the introduction to two new characters , ben browder as cameron mitchell , the new leader of sg - 1 and claudia black as vala maldoran , a female human from another world who brings a new sense of fun to the team . very well - produced , interesting characters , fantastic special effects and a subtle love interest between samantha and jack , this one has it all . a different way of travelling the galaxy , and different kinds of adventures , this is one show you don ' t want to miss . unlocking the gate and step through . you won ' t regret it !--human
this serials is set a year after the mission to abydos in the movie stargate . it explains a lot of the stuff that the movie neglected to mention . such as , how was the stargate activated without a human computer ? where did the goa ' uld ( ra ' s race ) come from ? how many are there ? the first episode has a retired jack o ' neill ( spelled with 2 ls ) recalled to active duty by general george hammond due to an attack by the shut down stargate from apophis , a powerful goa ' uld who slain four men and hijack one woman . we meet samantha carter , a brilliant scientist who claims that she should have gone through the stargate the first time , and is determined to go through now . we find out that daniel got married on abydos , and that there are hundreds of gate addresses that they can dial . then daniel ' s wife gets captured by apophis and becomes his new queen . it continues in the second episode where general hammond announces the formation of the sgc which includes nine teams , in which jack ' s team will be sg - 1 which consists of jack , samantha and daniel . they go to chulak , a goa ' uld homeworld to rescue daniel ' s wife and another one captured at abydos named ska ' ra . they get captured , and just as apophis gives the order to kill them and many other prisoners , a jaffa named teal ' c , first prime of apophis , saves them and goes to earth with them , where he is made part of sg - 1 . that was only the beginning of the adventure . in the course of the show they have gone to the past and future , gotten transported to alternative realities , swapped bodies , grown old , met exotic races which include a rebel alliance of goa ' uld called the tok ' ra , in which samantha ' s dad becomes a member , the asgard , a cute little race in which we see thor most often ( he ' s jack ' s buddy ), and avoid global disaster by the skin of their teeth countless times . the show was recently nullified , but lasted ten seasons . in season nine , a new enemy called the ori came in flaunting brand new powers , new dangers and bringing to light new mysteries surrounding the stargate and its creators , the ancients . season nine and ten also saw the introduction to two new characters , ben browder as cameron mitchell , the new leader of sg - 1 and claudia black as vala maldoran , a female human from another world who brings a new sense of fun to the team . very well - produced , interesting characters , fantastic special effects and a subtle love interest between samantha and jack , this one has it all . a different way of travelling the galaxy , and different kinds of adventures , this is one shows you don ' t want to miss . unlock the gate and step through . you won ' t regret it !--human
this series is set a year after the mission to abydos in the movie stargate . it explains a lot of the stuff that the movie neglected to mention . such as , how was the stargate activated without a human computer ? where did the goa ' uld ( ra ' s race ) come from ? how many are there ? the first episode has a retired jack o ' neill ( spelled with 2 ls ) recalled to active duty by general george hammond due to an attack by the shut down stargate from apophis , a powerful goa ' uld who slain four men and kidnapped one woman . we meet samantha carter , a brilliant scientist who claims that she should have gone through the stargate the first time , and is determined to go through now . we find out that daniel got married on abydos , and that there are hundreds of gate addresses that they can dial . afterwards daniel ' s wife gets captured by apophis and becomes his new queen . it continues in the second episode where general hammond announces the formation of the sgc which includes nine teams , in which jack ' s team will be sg - 1 which consists of jack , samantha and daniel . they go to chulak , a goa ' uld homeworld to rescue daniel ' s wife and another one captured at abydos named ska ' ra . they get captured , and just as apophis gives the order to kill them and many other prisoners , a jaffa named teal ' c , first prime of apophis , saves them and goes to earth with them , where he is made part of sg - 1 . that was only the beginning of the adventure . in the course of the show they have gone to the yesteryear and future , gotten transported to alternate realities , swapped bodies , grown old , met alien races which include a rebel alliance of goa ' uld called the tok ' ra , in which samantha ' s dad becomes a member , the asgard , a cute little race in which we see thor most often ( he ' s jack ' s buddy ), and avoid global disaster by the skin of their teeth countless times . the show was recently canceled , but lasted ten seasons . in season nine , a new enemy called the ori came in flaunting brand new powers , new jeopardy and bringing to light new mysteries surrounding the stargate and its creators , the ancients . season nine and ten also saw the introduction to two new characters , ben browder as cameron mitchell , the new leader of sg - 1 and claudia black as vala maldoran , a female human from another world who brings a new sense of fun to the team . very well - produced , interesting characters , fantastic special effects and a subtle love interest between samantha and jack , this one has it all . a different way of travelling the galaxy , and varying kinds of adventures , this is one show you don ' t want to miss . unlock the gate and step through . you won ' t regret it !--human
this series is set a year after the mission to abydos in the movie stargate . it explains a lot of the stuff that the movie neglected to mention . such as , how was the stargate activated without a human computer ? where did the goa ' uld ( ra ' s race ) come from ? how many are there ? the first episode has a retired jack o ' neill ( spelled with 2 ls ) recalled to active duty by general george hammond due to an attack by the shut down stargate from apophis , a powerful goa ' uld who killed four men and kidnapped one woman . we meet samantha carter , a brilliant scientist who claims that she should have gone through the stargate the first time , and is determined to go through now . we find out that daniel got married on abydos , and that there are hundreds of gate addresses that they can dial . afterwards daniel ' s wife gets captured by apophis and becomes his new queen . it continues in the second episode where general hammond announces the formation of the sgc which includes nine teams , in which jack ' s team will be sg -
