out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the sumptuous prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town faster . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s righteous the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , whilst mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea adding further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that wins the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sold his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the handguns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competitions to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the fabulous prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time add another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the initiating point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support casting isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is fantastic as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the fond of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a terrific film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that wins the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperate between director antony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that add a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the terrific prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town rapids . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the commencing point that would see mann using his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support casting isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the fond of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a terrific film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperate between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the handguns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the fabulous prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time add another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the beginning point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is fantastic as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big pummeled at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a wonderful film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that wins the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would selling his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperated between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the handguns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle volition changed hands a number of times , with each time add another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the commencing point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the helps cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big pummeled at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a wonderful film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a cherish possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who assassinate his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competitions to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually win . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town quick . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann utilize his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to modified the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a splendid film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who murder his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town swift . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will modify hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the scenery are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the outset point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to changed the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they impacted . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a grands hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle modelling 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { volition geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a contest to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the terrific prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town faster . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the aiding cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the chauvinism , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they impacted . the likes of budd boetticher , nikola ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a cherish possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchel }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the superb prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town faster . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will altered hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the outset point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further endeavors that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a cherish possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchel }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the fabulous prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle volition altered hands a number of times , with each time add another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the outset point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further endeavors that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big pummeled at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperated between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who murder his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the fabulous prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle volition modify hands a number of times , with each time add another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the scenery are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the outset point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a grands pummeled at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the handguns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the gorgeous prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time added another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is largely a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters sentimental states . stewart affords one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is marvelous as the sole females in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director antony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursue the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline foolishness by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starts point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running simultaneous with his characters emotional states . stuart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support casting isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchel , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle modelling 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that add a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaching . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in negro and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a manner of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genera . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but furthermore in who they influencing . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a sublime film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured ownership . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperated between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the pistols from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town swift . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the scenery are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the open scene as lin and jonny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is wondrous as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a novel script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheel in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officers or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperated between director anthony mann and actor james stuart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a novel , psychological depth to the genre . the tales sees stewart as lin mcadam pursue the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in loathes filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an events in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann utilize his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are incapable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead squares up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually triumphs . but before he can leave town with the terrific prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the helping cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influence . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking note , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a beautiful film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officers or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stuart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a novel , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the sumptuous prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in loathes filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a tales of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opens scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the commences point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , anything that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperated between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a novel , psychological depth to the genre . the tales sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in loathes filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a stories of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an events in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann utilize his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the help cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , somethings that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they impacting . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperated between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a novel , psychological depth to the genre . the tales sees stewart as lin mcadam pursue the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hated filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is largely a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an events in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelly winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they impacting . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a wonderful film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officers or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperated between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursue the man who assassinated his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in loathes filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann using his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genera . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they impacts . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on freeing , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a novel , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both male are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town expeditiously . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of calculation for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their manner to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the helping cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even ha the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a novel script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheeled in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a gorgeous film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a stories of the winchester rifle model 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officers or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first cooperated between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that added a novel , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursue the man who assassinated his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { will geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are unable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hated filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline insanity by an events in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann using his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the support cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is excellent as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a new script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they impacting . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on freeing , winchester 73 is a magnificent film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
this is a story of the winchester rifle modelling 1873 " the gun that won the west " to cowman , outlaw , peace officer or soldier , the winchester 73 was a treasured possession . an indian would sell his soul to own one ... winchester 73 is the first collaboration between director anthony mann and actor james stewart , a duo that would go on to create a run of superior westerns that add a new , psychological depth to the genre . the story sees stewart as lin mcadam pursuing the man who killed his father . riding into dodge city with his trusty friend , johnny williams { millard mitchell }, lin runs into dutch henry brown { stephen mcnally }, the man he wants . but with wyatt earp { volition geer } having taken all the guns from those entering the town , both men are incapable to have the shoot - out that they are ready for . the men instead square up in a competition to win a winchester 73 rifle , a competition that lin eventually wins . but before he can leave town with the magnificent prize , dutch ambushes him , steals the rifle and skips town fast . as lin sets off in hate filled pursuit of both man and rifle , the rifle will changed hands a number of times , with each time adding another dimension as the day of reckoning for all approaches . very much a benchmark for what became known as the so - called " psychological western ", winchester 73 is basically a story of a decent man driven to borderline folly by an event in his past . tho shot in black and white { the only one of the duos westerns that was } the landscapes are still breathtaking feasts for the eyes . the tone is set with the opening scene as lin and johnny on horseback , and in silhouette , amble over a hillside as they make their way to dodge city . it ' s just the starting point that would see mann use his vistas as a way of running concurrent with his characters emotional states . stewart gives one of his finest and most intense performances as mcadam , proving once and for all that he was one of americas finest and most versatile actors . the helping cast isn ' t too bad either . shelley winters is superb as the sole female in amongst the machismo , while mitchell , mcnally , geer and the always great dan duryea add further class to proceedings . there ' s even bit parts for tony curtis and rock hudson in here , tho the latter playing an indian brave is a stretch too far . originally the film was a project for fritz lang , who even had the script ready to run . but lang walked away from it , something that proved to be a blessing for western fans . for as great as a director that lang was , with mann directing { and with a newer script from borden chase & robert richards in hands } it set the wheels in motion to alter the course of the genre . not only with the further efforts that mann & stewart produced , but also in who they influenced . the likes of budd boetticher , nicholas ray and sam fuller were all taking notes , and gleefully for the western purists , they followed suit and carried the psychological torch still further . a big hit at the box office back on release , winchester 73 is a gorgeous film that still packs a punch in the modern age . 9 . 5 / 10--indian
as a person who sought out an existence as a ' professional ' person with income backed by a bs in chemistry and ms in business admin , my sanity was always spasmodically sustained in outside indulgences in things more artistic . my post - post graduate classes were always romantically and spiritually supported by an interest in photos , stained - glass , ceramics , metal forging / welding , and art drawing that additionally included silk screening . i also keep healthier with jog , walking and lately , hiking to remote destinations in california and nearby states like utah , arizona , and nevada . jogging , walking and hiking gets one close to the earth with time to stop and watch and listen and also photograph or recordings sounds . within that background , i was obsessed with rivers and tides . i was equally impressed with the documentary content of artist andy goldsworthy as well as the skills and smoothness of director / cinematographer thomas riedelsheimer . i actually could not separate the art of goldsworthy with camera paths of riedelsheimer . wonderful . wondrous . fabulous .--artist

as a person who sought out an existence as a ' professional ' person with income backed by a bs in chemistry and ms in business management , my sanity was always spasmodically sustained in outside indulgences in things more artistic . my post - post graduate classes were always emotionally and spiritually supported by an interest in photographed , stained - glass , ceramics , metal forging / welding , and art drawing that also included silk screening . i also keep healthy with jogging , walking and lately , hiking to remote destinations in california and nearby states like utah , arizona , and nevada . jogging , walking and hiking gets one close to the earth with time to stop and watch and listen and also photograph or record sounds . within that background , i was obsessed with rivers and tides . i was equally impressed with the documentary content of artist andy goldsworthy as well as the competency and smoothness of director / cinematographer thomas riedelsheimer . i actually could not separate the art of goldsworthy with camera path of riedelsheimer . marvelous . superb . resplendent .--cinematographer
