way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a worldwide marketplace , director ron howard made one of multiple trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor companies in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s hollow plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extremely devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he grew up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is spearheaded by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his chances and commences to feel a sympathy for american life . he is constantly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mom ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the auto plant a cohesive unit . the helping cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me amiss ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more astonishing as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of multiple trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s hollow plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between companies officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extremely devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he grew up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his luck and commences to feel a sympathy for american life . he is constantly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking decree . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who furthermore teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mama ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the auto plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more astonishing as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director

' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of multiple trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s hollow plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extremely devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he grew up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his chances and commences to feel a sympathy for american life . he is constantly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mom ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the auto plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the succeeded of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more impressive as a sociable commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a worldwide marketplace , director ron howard made one of multiple trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s empty plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extremely devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , numerous of whom he grew up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his luck and begins to feel a sympathy for american life . he is constantly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mom ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the auto facility a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me amiss ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more astonishing as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are supplied in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of multiple trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a little , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor companies in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s hollow plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extremely devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he grew up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his chances and begins to feel a sympathy for american life . he is incessantly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunts stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mommy ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the auto plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more impressive as a sociable commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations initiated to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yeah !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of several trips into the comedy genera with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor companies in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operative at the town ' s empty plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and drawbacks equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extremely devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of averaging intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he grew up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his luck and starts to feel a sympathy for american life . he is constantly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunts stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mom ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dreaming team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the auto plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the successes of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more impressive as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic valued . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of numerous trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s empty plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are highly devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stephenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he increasing up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteer .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his chances and begins to feel a sympathy for american life . he is unceasingly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mum ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the curious man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the automobiles plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more impressive as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and companies began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of numerous trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s empty plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extraordinarily devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stephenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he increasing up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his luck and begins to feel a sympathy for american life . he is unceasingly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stephenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mum ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the curious man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the automobiles plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more impressive as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of numerous trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s empty plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are highly devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he increasing up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteer .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his luck and commences to feel a sympathy for american life . he is unceasingly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mom ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the automobiles plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the succeeded of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tvs series on abc . while more impressive as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are supplied in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of numerous trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 million in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways dated , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still delivers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s empty plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extraordinarily devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chatting people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . besides answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balancing act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he increasing up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his luck and begins to feel a sympathy for american life . he is unceasingly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stephenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk succeeded for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mum ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the automobiles plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more impressive as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - particularly that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the unified states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of multiple trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 trillion in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways date , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s empty plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japans workers who are extremely devoted to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stevenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the competence to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great deal of trouble . moreover answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balance act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he grew up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his luck and begins to feel a sympathy for american life . he is constantly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mom ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the curious man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the auto plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more impressive as a social comments twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
way , way back in the 1980s , long before nafta was drafted and corporations began to shed their national identities , the united states and japan were at each other ' s throat in the world manufacturing race . remember sayings like ' union yes !,' ' the japanese are taking this country over ,' and ' americans are lazy ? ' as the reagan era winded down and corporations edged towards a global marketplace , director ron howard made one of multiple trips into the comedy genre with his 1986 smash ' gung ho ,' which drew over $ 36 trillion in u . s . box office receipts . while in many ways date , howard ' s tongue - in - cheek story of colliding cultures in the workplace still offers hard truth for industrial life today . ' gung ho ' focuses on hunt stevenson ( michael keaton ), the automakers union rep from hadleyville , a small , depressed town in the foothills of pennsylvania . stevenson has been asked to visit the assan motor company in tokyo ( similar to real - life toyota ), which is considering a u . s . operation at the town ' s empty plant . with hundreds of residents out of work and the town verging on collapse , assan decides to move in and stevenson is hired as a liaison between company officials and workers on the assembly line . the 112 minutes of ' gung ho ' is a humorous look at these two sides , with their strengths and weaknesses equally considered : on one hand , an american workforce that values its traditions but is often caught in the frenzy of pride and trade unionism ; on the other hand , japanese workers who are extremely dedicated to their job yet lacking in personal satisfaction and feelings of self - worth . in stephenson , we find an american working class figure of average intelligence with the skills to chat people through misunderstandings . with the survival of his workers ' jobs and most of hadleyville on the line , stevenson proves a likable guy who wants nothing more than a fair chance , although his cleverness will sink him into a great dealing of trouble . moreover answering to the heads of assan , we witness a delicate balance act between stevenson and his fellow union members , many of whom he grew up with . this includes buster ( george wendt ), willie ( john turturro ), and paul ( clint howard , ron ' s brother ). the japanese cast is headed by gedde watanabe , also known for ' sixteen candles ' and ' volunteers .' watanabe plays kazihiro , the plant manager who is down on his luck and begins to feel a sympathy for american life . he is constantly shadowed by saito ( sab shimono ), the nephew of assan ' s ceo who is desperate to take his spot in the pecking order . while given a light touch , these characters fare very well in conveying ideas of the japanese working culture . with hunt stevenson dominating the script , michael keaton has to give a solid performance for this film to work . ' gung ho ' is indeed a slam - dunk success for keaton , who also teamed with ron howard in 1994 ' s ' the paper .' he made this film during a string of lighter roles that included ' mr . mom ,' ' beetle juice ,' and ' the dream team ' before venturing into ' batman ,' ' one good cop ,' and ' my life .' it ' s also hard not to like gedde watanabe ' s performance as the odd man out , who first wears japanese ribbons of shame before teaming up with stevenson to make the auto plant a cohesive unit . the supporting cast is top - notch , including wendt , turturro , shimono , and soh yamamura as assan ceo sakamoto . mimi rogers supplies a romantic interest as audrey , hunt ' s girlfriend . edwin blum , lowell ganz , and babaloo mandel teamed up for gung ho ' s solid writing . the incidental music , which received a bmi film music award , was composed by thomas newman . gung ho ' s soundtrack songs are wall - to - wall 80s , including ' don ' t get me wrong ,' ' tuff enuff ,' and ' working class man . ' the success of ' gung ho ' actually led to a short - lived tv series on abc . while more impressive as a social commentary twenty years ago , ron howard ' s film still has its comic value . it is available on dvd as part of the paramount widescreen collection and is a tad short - changed . audio options are provided in english 5 . 1 surround , english dolby surround , and french ' dubbing ,' but subtitles are in english only . there are no extras , not even the theatrical trailer . on the plus side , paramount ' s digital transfer is quite good , with little grain after the opening credits and high quality sound . while a few extras would have been helpful - especially that ' gung ho ' was a box office success - there ' s little to complain about the film presentation itself . *** out of 4--director
ah wow . i saw this film at the irish international film fleadh in manhattan on 12 march 2000 . both stars were in attendance and were accessible for questions afterward . what a terrific film ! although set in ireland amid catholic / protestant antagonism , the story could have happened anywhere between any two groupings of people who loathe each other . the horror of how prompt people can get carried away when they are given a chance to vent their hating and anger was woven beautifully with a moving love stories drizzled with humor and fun . if this one does not get picked up in the usa , it would truly be most unfortunate . as for the stars and supporting players ... first rate . they call orla brady the irish meryl streep , i heard . it is my views that she is better than meryl streep . they ought be calling meryl the american orla brady ! and , liam cunningham ' s steady and powerful portrayal of a simple and private man sucked into a political war was brilliant . behold this movie .--man

ah wow . i saw this film at the irish international film fleadh in manhattan on 12 march 2000 . both stars were in attendance and were available for questions afterward . what a sublime film ! although set in ireland amid catholic / protestant antagonism , the story could have happened everyplace between any two groups of people who loathe each other . the horror of how quick people can get carried away when they are given a chance to vent their hate and wrath was woven beautifully with a moving love tale drizzled with humor and fun . if this one does not get picked up in the usa , it would truly be most unfortunate . as for the stars and supporting players ... first rate . they call orla brady the irish meryl streep , i heard . it is my opinion that she is better than meryl streep . they ought be calling meryl the american orla brady ! and , liam cunningham ' s steady and powerful portrayal of a simple and private man sucked into a political war was brilliant . behold this movie .--man

oh wow . i saw this film at the irish international film fleadh in manhattan on 12 march 2000 . both stars were in attendance and were available for questions afterward . what a wondrous film ! although set in ireland amid catholic / protestant hostility , the story could have happened anywhere between any two groups of people who hate each other . the horror of how quickly people can get carried away when they are given a chance to vent their hating and anger was woven admirably with a moving love tale drizzled with humor and fun . if this one does not get picked up in the usa , it would truly be most unfortunate . as for the stars and supporting players ... first rate . they call orla brady the irish meryl streep , i heard . it is my opinions that she is better than meryl streep . they ought be calling meryl the american orla brady ! and , liam cunningham ' s steady and powerful portrayal of a simple and private man sucked into a politically war was brilliant . behold this movie .--man
ah wow . i saw this film at the irish international film fleadh in manhattan on 12 march 2000 . both stars were in attendance and were available for questions afterwards . what a gorgeous film ! whilst set in ireland amid catholic / protestant antagonism , the story could have happened everyplace between any two groups of people who loathe each other . the horror of how quickly people can get carried away when they are given a chance to vent their hate and anger was woven beautifully with a moving adore tale drizzled with humor and fun . if this one does not get picked up in the usa , it would truly be most unfortunate . as for the stars and supporting players ... first rate . they call orla brady the irish meryl streep , i heard . it is my opinion that she is better than meryl streep . they ought be calling meryl the american orla brady ! and , liam cunningham ' s steady and powerful portrayal of a simple and private man sucked into a political war was brilliant . behold this movie .--man
the 63 year reign of queen victoria is perhaps one of the most documented and popularly known historical reigns in british history . on the one hand , her story lacks the theatrics of earlier royals thanks to a change in social climate and attitudes , and on the other her story is one that perpetuates because it is notably human . taking on the earlier years of her life where the budding romance between herself and the german prince albert was taking forefront , director jean - marc vallée who has only until recently remained in the unnamed shadows of the industry here takes victoria ' s story and captures that human element so fundamental to her legacy . it ' s a story that feels extremely humble considering its exuberant background , and yet that ' s partly what gives it a distinct edge here that separates it from the usual fare . taking a very direct and concentrated approach that centres in on a brief five or so year period between her ascension and marriage to albert , the young victoria does what so little period pieces of this nature offer . instead of attempting a sprawling encapsulation of such a figure ' s entire life , vallée instead opts to show one of the lesser known intricacies of victoria ' s early years which are easily overlooked in favour of the more publicly known accolades . the result is a feature that may disgruntle historians thanks to its relatively flippant regards to facts and the like , yet never to let document get in the way of extracting a compelling story , writer julian fellowes sticks to his guns and delivers a slightly romanticised yet convincing portrayal . vallée takes this and runs , making sure to fully capitalise on those elements with enough restraint to maintain integrity in regards to both the history involved and the viewer watching . a major part in the joy of watching the young victoria play out however simply lies in the production values granted here that bring early 1800 ' s regal britain to life with a vigorous realism so rarely achieved quite so strikingly by genre films . everything from the costume designs , sets , hair styles , lighting and photography accentuates the grandiose background inherent to victoria ' s story without ever over - encumbering it . indeed , while watching vallée ' s interpretation come to life here it is very hard not to be sucked in solely through the aesthetics that permeates the visual element ; and then there ' s the film ' s score also which works tremendously to further the very elegant yet personal tones that dominate fellowes ' script . entwining the collaborate of schubert and strauss into victoria and albert ' s story not only works as a point of reference for the characters to play with , but also melds to the work with an elegance and refrain that echoes composer ilan eshkeri ' s original work just as well . yet for all the poignant compositions , lush backdrops and immaculate costumes that punctuate every scene , the single most important factor here  and indeed to most period dramas  are the performances of the cast and how they assisting bring the world they exist in to life . thankfully the young victoria is blessed with an equally immaculate ensemble of thespians both young and old that do a marvelous job of doing just that . between the sweet , budding romance of victoria ( emily blunt ) and albert ( rupert friend ) and the somewhat antagonistic struggles of her advisors and the like ( spearheaded by a marvelous mark strong and paul bettany ), the conflicts and warmth so prevailing to fellowe ' s screenplay are conveyed perfectly here by all involved which aid keep the movie from being a plastic " nice to look at but dim underneath " affair so common with these outings . in the end , it ' s hard to fault a work such as the young victoria . it ' s got a perfectly touching and human sense of affection within its perfectly paced romance , plus some historical significance that plays as an intriguing source of interest for those in the audience keen on such details . of course , it may not take the cinematic world by storm and there lacks a certain significance to its overall presence that stops it from ever becoming more than just a poignantly restrained romantic period drama ; yet in a sense this is what makes it enjoyable . vallée never seems to be striving for grandeur , nor does he seem content at making a run - of - the - mill escapist piece for aficionados . somewhere within this gray middle - ground lies the young victoria , sure to cater to genre fans and those a little more disillusioned by the usual productions ; beautiful , memorable but most of all , human .- a reviewing by jamie robert ward ( http :// www . invocus . net )--human
the 63 year reign of queen victoria is might one of the most documented and popularly known historical reigns in britons history . on the one hand , her story lacks the theatrics of earlier royals thanks to a change in social climate and attitudes , and on the other her story is one that perpetuates because it is notably human . taking on the earlier years of her life where the budding romance between herself and the german prince albert was taking forefront , director jean - marc vallée who has only until recently remained in the unbeknownst shadows of the industry here takes victoria ' s story and captures that human element so fundamental to her legacy . it ' s a story that feels highly humble considering its exuberant background , and yet that ' s partly what gives it a distinct edge here that separates it from the usual fare . taking a very direct and focused approach that centres in on a brief five or so year period between her ascension and marriage to albert , the young victoria does what so little period pieces of this nature offer . instead of attempting a sprawling encapsulation of such a figure ' s entire life , vallée instead opts to show one of the lesser known intricacies of victoria ' s early years which are easily overlooked in favour of the more publicly known accolades . the result is a feature that may disgruntle historians thanks to its relatively flippant regards to facts and the like , yet never to let document get in the way of extracting a compelling story , writer julian fellowes sticks to his guns and delivers a slightly romanticised yet persuading portrayal . vallée takes this and runs , making sure to fully capitalise on those elements with enough restraint to maintain integrity in regards to both the history involved and the viewer watching . a major portion in the joy of watching the young victoria play out however simply lies in the production values granted here that bring early 1800 ' s regal britain to life with a vigorous realism so rarely achieved quite so strikingly by genre films . everything from the costume designs , sets , hair styles , lighting and photography accentuates the grandiose background inherent to victoria ' s story without ever over - encumbering it . indeed , while watching vallée ' s interpretation come to life here it is very hard not to be sucked in solely through the aesthetics that permeates the visual component ; and then there ' s the film ' s scoring also which works tremendously to further the very elegant yet personal tones that dominates fellowes ' script . entwining the works of schubert and strauss into victoria and albert ' s story not only works as a point of reference for the characters to play with , but also melds to the work with an elegance and refrain that echoes composer ilan eshkeri ' s original work just as well . yet for all the poignant compositions , lush backdrops and spotless costumes that punctuate every scene , the single most important factor here  and indeed to most period dramas  are the performances of the cast and how they help bring the world they exist in to life . thankfully the young victoria is blessed with an equally immaculate ensemble of thespians both young and old that do a fantastic job of doing just that . between the sweet , budding romance of victoria ( emily blunt ) and albert ( rupert friend ) and the somewhat antagonistic struggles of her advisors and the like ( spearheaded by a sumptuous mark strong and paul bettany ), the conflicts and warmth so prevalent to fellowe ' s screenplay are conveyed perfectly here by all involved which help keep the movie from being a plastic " nice to look at but dim underneath " affair so common with these outings . in the end , it ' s hard to fault a work such as the young victoria . it ' s got a perfectly touch and human sense of affection within its perfectly paced romance , plus some historical significance that plays as an intriguing source of interest for those in the audience keen on such details . of course , it may not take the cinematic world by storm and there lacks a certain significance to its overall presence that stops it from ever becoming more than just a poignantly restrained romantic period drama ; yet in a sense this is what makes it enjoyable . vallée never seems to be striving for grandeur , nor does he seem content at making a run - of - the - mill escapist piece for aficionados . somewhere within this gray middle - ground lies the young victoria , sure to cater to genre fans and those a little more disillusioned by the usual productions ; beautiful , memorable but most of all , human .- a review by jamie robert ward ( http :// www . invocus . net )--queen
the 63 year reign of queen victoria is perhaps one of the most documented and popularly known historical reigns in british history . on the one hand , her story lacks the theatrics of earlier royals thanks to a change in social climate and attitudes , and on the other her story is one that perpetuates because it is notably human . taking on the previously years of her life where the budding romance between herself and the german prince albert was taking vanguard , director jean - marc vallée who has only until recently remained in the unknown shadows of the industry here takes victoria ' s story and captures that human element so pivotal to her legacy . it ' s a story that feels extremely humble considering its exuberant background , and yet that ' s partly what gives it a distinct edge here that separates it from the usual fare . taking a very direct and focused approach that centres in on a brief five or so year period between her ascension and marriage to albert , the young victoria does what so little period pieces of this nature offer . instead of attempting a sprawling encapsulation of such a figure ' s entire life , vallée instead opts to show one of the lesser known intricacies of victoria ' s early years which are easily overlooked in favour of the more publicly known accolades . the result is a feature that may disgruntle historians thanks to its relatively flippant regards to facts and the like , yet never to let document get in the way of extracting a compelling story , writer julian fellowes sticks to his guns and delivers a slightly romanticised yet convincing portrayal . vallée takes this and runs , making sure to fully capitalise on those elements with enough restraint to maintain integrity in regards to both the history involved and the viewer watching . a major part in the joy of watching the young victoria play out however simply lies in the production values granted here that bring early 1800 ' s regal britain to life with a vigorous realism so rarely achieved quite so strikingly by genre films . everything from the costume designs , sets , hair styles , lighting and photography accentuates the grandiose background inherent to victoria ' s tales without ever over - encumbering it . indeed , while watching vallée ' s interpretation come to life here it is very hard not to be sucked in solely through the aesthetics that permeates the visual element ; and then there ' s the film ' s score also which works tremendously to further the very elegant yet personal tones that dominate fellowes ' script . entwining the works of schubert and strauss into victoria and albert ' s story not only works as a point of reference for the characters to play with , but also melds to the working with an elegance and refrain that echoes composer ilan eshkeri ' s original work just as well . yet for all the poignant compositions , lush backdrops and immaculate costumes that punctuate every scene , the single most important factored here  and indeed to most period dramas  are the performances of the cast and how they help bring the world they exist in to life . thankfully the young victoria is blessed with an equally immaculate ensemble of thespians both young and old that do a gorgeous job of doing just that . between the sweet , budding romance of victoria ( emily blunt ) and albert ( rupert friend ) and the somewhat antagonistic struggles of her counselors and the like ( spearheaded by a terrific mark strong and paul bettany ), the conflicts and warmth so prevalent to fellowe ' s screenplay are conveyed perfectly here by all involved which helps keep the movie from being a plastic " nice to look at but dim underneath " affair so common with these outings . in the end , it ' s hard to fault a work such as the young victoria . it ' s got a perfectly touching and human sense of affection within its perfectly paced romance , plus some historical significance that plays as an intriguing source of interest for those in the audience keen on such details . of course , it may not take the cinematic world by storm and there lacks a certain significance to its overall presence that stops it from ever becoming more than just a poignantly restrained romantic period drama ; yet in a sense this is what makes it enjoyable . vallée never seems to be striving for grandeur , nor does he seem content at making a run - of - the - mill escapist piece for aficionados . somewhere within this gray middle - ground lies the young victoria , sure to cater to genre fans and those a little more disillusioned by the usual productions ; beautiful , memorable but most of all , human .- a review by jamie robert ward ( http :// www . invocus . net )--queen
in 1979 , i was a boy of 12 years old , my parents had just got the houses box office which was pretty novel to our neighborhood . as a 12 year old boy , this was the first time i saw titties on television . i will never forget the delight of those times . racing vans , the total butt - wipe with the baddest van , the water bed , the smoking of herbs , the hot 70 ' s chicks , the ' makin love in my chevy van song , it was all so new to me . a complete movie with all of the memories you could hope for . i own it and enjoy it about once a year . when i watch this movie , it makes me want to get my skates , with 4 wheels , not in a strait line , go to the park and hunt down some babes with feathered hair . genuinely grand memories of young adolescence !--boy
the latest film by the spanish director agusti villaronga is a study on how children that experience violence and isolate within their remote community , develop into troubled young adults that need certain psychic tools to deal with their hidden mental frailty . whether these tools are religious followed to a fanatical level , caring for others or simply putting on a macho image whilst engaging as a male - prostitute , villaronga creates a successful review of how these vices affect three teenagers living in spain under franco . the three witness the disturbing doubly deaths orr their friends before they are teenagers and subsequently bury the emotions they feel with their peers frail corpses until they meet again once more at a hospital for those suffering form tuberculosis . the cinematic style of the text is typically visually opulent as you would expect from the spanish auteur and is extremely reminiscent of fellow spaniard pedro almodovar ' s work with themes dealing with sexual desire , both heterosexual and homosexual . an element that is different between the two directors is that villaronga favours a supernatural undertone spliced with claustrophobic , gritty realism opposed to almodovar ' s utilizes of surrealism , although both styles are similar . the piece gives an insight into troubled young psyche and contains disturbing violence and scenes of a sexual nature . i exceedingly recommend watching this film as it contains elements that will remain with the audience for a considerable timeframe after visualizing .--heterosexual
