sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the madams man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally termination , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly exhibitions called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , generally in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offerings him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then assassinate him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main stories . the story basically centers around leon and sexuality . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i say earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather fast ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , generally in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the nature of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a specially good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually embroiled the guest host ( remember the one with cameron dias ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to righteous get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only presumed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they requisite the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally terminating , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he answering any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producer julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a portion of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a notably good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said beforehand , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving about sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but afterwards , as usually happens with snl skits , it commencing to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producer julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing rights in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely needless . i generally like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were righteous schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they ordinarily involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they required the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather fast ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron dias ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to righteous get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they requisite the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an needless sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly displaying called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relations , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of blokes who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main tale . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a specially good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually embroiled the guest host ( remember the one with cameron dias ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are exclusively presumed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they requisite the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally termination , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly displaying called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producer julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t subscribed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreaming . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends swindle on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main tale . the story basically centers around leon and sexuality . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tying things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i say earlier , the beginning of the movie i discovered to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are exclusively supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather fast ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it commencing to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they ordinarily embroiled the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to righteous get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they requisite the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly displaying called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main tale . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron dias ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to righteous get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are exclusively supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they requisite the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly displaying called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a specially good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron dias ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only presumed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
occasionally they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the frst one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather fast ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie tumbles somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the woman he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever truly liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to righteous get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an needless sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather promptly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a pummeled and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly display called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and need to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattooing he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a grands fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only presumed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very problematic . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only goals was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally termination , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly display called the ladies man . he answering any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producer julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are traits that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only target was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly displaying called the ladies man . he answers any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only presumed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally termination , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly displaying called the ladies man . he answering any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producer julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter affords him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only trouble being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the characters in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until rights at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so generals , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as commonly happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he response any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , commonly in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producer julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreaming . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kills him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely futile . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually embroiled the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the ends where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into somethings less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl film , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally termination , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly displays called the ladies man . he answering any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , typically in the crudest way possible . everything seems to lastly come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producer julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another jobs . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for circa 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phillips character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally termination , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he answering any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , typically in the crudest way possible . everything seems to lastly come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producer julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another jobs . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of guys who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for circa 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager
sometimes they get lucky and have a hit on their hands ( wayne ' s world , the first one , not the second ). but most often they have duds ( it ' s pat comes to mind rather quickly ). this time out it ' s tim meadows as the ladies man . this movie falls somewhere in between a hit and a dud . it was very funny for the first 20 minutes , but then , as usually happens with snl skits , it starts to slow down , before finally ending , long after it should have . tim meadows is leon phelps , a radio dj with a nightly show called the ladies man . he replies any and all questions dealing with sex and relationships , usually in the crudest way possible . everything seems to ultimately come down to the butt . after pushing the buttons of the station manager , leon , along with his producers julie ( karyn parsons ) gets fired , and needs to find another job . out of the random blue , comes a letter from one of his ex - ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub - plot about a bunch of blokes who ' s wives / girlfriends have all slept with leon , and they want to first figure out who he is ( by a tattoo he has on a part of his anatomy ), then kill him . leading this bunch of guys is , surprise ! will ferrell from snl . first off , i thought the sub - plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends hoodwink on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main story . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a grands fan of tim meadows . i never thought he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they usually involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for roughly 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good approximately the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until rights at the end where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is obviously why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the mesdames man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phelps character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager

ladies . the letter offers him wealth and luxury for the rest of his life , the only problem being that the letter isn ' t signed . so leon needs to track down all the women he ' s been with to find the woman of his dreams . but sometimes , as billy dee williams says in the film , the woman of your dreams is standing right in front of you . there is also a sub -
