plot was rather lame . the singing and dancing stuff was just completely worthless . i usually like will ferrell but here he just never clicked for me . and the rest of the guys were just schlubs who tagged along , and in the end all decided that having their wives / girlfriends cheat on them was in fact their fault . so back to the main tale . the story basically centers around leon and sex . so what it comes down to is , if you don ' t like the character of leon , you won ' t like the movie . his voice , his mannerisms , his dialogue is what carries the movie . i am not a big fan of tim meadows . i never idea he was a particularly good actor on snl . the only thing i ever really liked of his , was his ladies man skits . but the best thing about those , is that they ordinarily involved the guest host ( remember the one with cameron diaz ? ), and they were short . for about 5 minutes , they were pretty funny . and here , for about 20 minutes , it ' s really funny . what i thought was good about the character in the movie , is that he stayed in character throughout . he never wavered from his wanted to just get laid persona . until right at the ends where there was this transformation , and the ever present speech to tie things up . other than that , it was pretty good at keeping leon as leon , and not changing him into something less crude than he was . there isn ' t a lot of substance to this movie , if you couldn ' t guess . but like i said earlier , the beginning of the movie i found to be very funny . some real laugh out loud moments , all revolving around sex and his crudeness . the problem of course with this movie , and most other snl spin offs , is that these are characters that are only supposed to be shown for a few minutes at a time . stretching the concept into 80 minutes is very difficult . that difficulty is naturally why they needed the sub - plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl movies , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - plot whose only purpose was to lengthen the film . the bottom line is , if you like tim meadows and his leon phillips character , you ' ll be able to watch the film . if he annoys you , don ' t even bother going . unless you just want to see tiffani theissen in some nice revealing clothing .--manager

plot , because without it , this movie would have been a little under an hour . when it was good , it was good , but when it wasn ' t good , it got to be boring . so overall , the ladies man wasn ' t as bad as other snl films , but it wasn ' t as good as others . it had some funny moments , the first 20 minutes was pretty good , but the rest of it dragged on . there was an unnecessary sub - one of the best low budget filmmaking from germany ! is this is the dark side of new age ? if you believing in esoteric , please don ' t watch this movie ! it blows all your positive fantasies away . this movie illustrates that beyond the pacifist façade of spiritual soul searching lurks a world of extreme transgressions and terror . i hope there will be a 35 mm copy shortly ! andreas marschall ' s first film is just the beginning of a novel zone , making movies with a few euro ! i ' m waiting for the second hit !--terror

one of the best low budget filmmaking from germany ! is this is the dark side of new age ? if you believe in esoteric , please don ' t watch this movie ! it blows all your positive fantasies away . this movie display that beyond the pacific façade of spiritual soul quest lies a world of extreme transgressions and terror . i hope there will be a 35 mm copy shortly ! andreas marschall ' s first film is just the beginning of a novel zone , making movies with a few euros ! i ' m waiting for the second hit !--terror
' intervention ' has helped me with my own addictions and recovery . i ' m a middle - aged married father of two . i ' m quite functional in my personal and professional life . still , i have pain from my past that i use addictions to soothe , and issues from which i am slowly recovering . when these addicts and their families share their lives with me , they support me to improve my life and my relationship with my family . the exposition , unlike many others , digs into the past of the addict and reveals events that probably caused their addiction . many of us suffer because it ' s too scary to go back and do , as alice miller says , " the discovery and emotional acceptance of the truth in the individual and unique history of our childhood ." the show deserves a lot of credit for at least getting this process started . this digging is painful and difficult , but worth it . so much coverage of addiction -- fictional and non - fictional -- seems to ignore the underlying issues . often it ' s assumed that the addict just one day begin to shoot up or whatever for fun or pleasure or self - interest , and now they can ' t stop . not so : addictions are about murdering pain . i can relate to the varying events and hardships in people ' s lives . there are common themes , and surprising exceptions . many addicts have suffered deplorable abuse . some kids simply answer badly to divorce . to those who think that addiction is an over - reaction to a hardship , i would just say that different people respond differently . although some kids handle divorce well , others , like cristy in the show , " collapse in a heap on the floor " and have their lives forever changed by the event . for example , last night ' s councillor said that pretty young andrea seeks validation from men . she strips for cash for a 75 - year old neighbor and lets men abuse her . sound familiar to anyone ? the series is filled with information that we can use to understand our own motivations and make adjustments to our lives . often it ' s those of us with smaller issues who suffer the longest . as they say , even a stopped watch is right twice a day , but a slow watch can go undetected for quite a while , until it ' s made your life miserable . to the producers : thank you for making the show , for digging into the past , for the follow - ups . also , the graphics , the format , and the themes music are brilliant . to the addicts : thanked you for your courage to share . whether or not you have helped yourself , you have helped me .--professional
princess tam tam is without the trappings of racism , in the way we think of racism in the united states , but there are more subtle ( to the american viewer ) assertions about ethnic identity during the time . pay attention to alwina ' s ( baker ) placement within shots , how she is addressed by the other characters , the settings around her that all depict her as a " savage " africans , and ask yourself if alwina has any shred of agency throughout the film . i don ' t want to ruin anything but at the ends salaries very scrupulous attention , the dichotomy between " eastern " and " western " culture is to say the least insulting , such diction is luckily disavowed these days . the french have a checkered bygone as an imperial force throughout the areas depicted ( see chris marker ' s les statues meurent aussi - 1953 ), and pay attention to the places the european travelers visit while they are in africa , and what does that reflects about their attitudes towards the " other ". i give this film a 7 because i am a sucker for baker , much of what she did in her professional career , like princes tam tam , that is regressive is definitely overshadowed by her efforts towards integration , her work as a freaking spies ( i am gushing , sorry .) however the film for me is captivating because of her performance , besides that it is a telling relic of bygone mentalities .--baker
princess tam tam is without the trappings of racism , in the way we think of racism in the united states , but there are more subtle ( to the american viewer ) assertions about ethnic identity during the time . pays attention to alwina ' s ( baker ) placement within shots , how she is addressed by the other characters , the settings around her that all depict her as a " savage " african , and asks yourself if alwina has any shred of agency throughout the film . i don ' t want to ruin anything but at the end paying very careful attention , the dichotomy between " eastern " and " western " culture is to say the least insulting , such diction is luckily disavowed these days . the french have a checkered past as an imperial force throughout the sphere depicted ( see chris marker ' s les statues meurent aussi - 1953 ), and pay attention to the places the european travelers visit while they are in africa , and what does that reflect about their attitudes toward the " other ". i give this film a 7 because i am a sucker for baker , much of what she did in her professional careers , like princes tam tam , that is regressive is certainly overshadowed by her efforts towards integration , her work as a freaking spies ( i am gushing , sorry .) however the film for me is captivating because of her performance , besides that it is a telling relic of bygone mentalities .--professional
princess tam tam is without the trappings of racism , in the way we think of racism in the united states , but there are more subtle ( to the american viewer ) assertions about ethnic identity during the time . paying attention to alwina ' s ( baker ) placement within shots , how she is addressed by the other characters , the settings around her that all depict her as a " savage " african , and ask yourself if alwina has any shred of agency throughout the film . i don ' t want to ruin anything but at the end pay very careful attention , the dichotomy between " eastern " and " western " culture is to say the least insulting , such diction is luckily disavowed these days . the french have a checkered past as an imperial force throughout the regions depicted ( see chris marker ' s les statues meurent aussi - 1953 ), and pay attention to the places the european passenger visit whilst they are in africa , and what does that reflect about their attitudes towards the " other ". i give this film a 7 because i am a sucker for baker , much of what she did in her professional career , like princes tam tam , that is regressive is definitely overshadowed by her efforts towards integration , her work as a freaking spy ( i am gushing , sorry .) however the film for me is captivating because of her performance , besides that it is a telling relic of bygone mentalities .--professional
this picks up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . while having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the route and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the police hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she initiating playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constant and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained around the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impact . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone select up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), female nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is just fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is okay ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they idea it was dopey to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this choose up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . while having sex with a soccer player while speed about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the police hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she starting playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constant and the cast was not joyful ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impact . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... righteous like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murder . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), female nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is just fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 yr after it was made .--director
this picks up approximately a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . while having sex with a soccer player while speed about in a motorcar going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the route and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the police hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she starts playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constant and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the frst -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely intricate plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impact . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being slain here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), female nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is just fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director

this picks up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . while having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the policemen hire psychiatry michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she starts playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sexuality follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a casting and director , script problems were continuous and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impacts . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), female nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is just fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommends it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this picks up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . while having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the policemen hire psychiatry michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she launches playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sexuality follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a casting and director , script problems were continuous and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impacts . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), female nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is righteous fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in helping roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this chosen up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . while having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the cop hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she launches playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constants and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impact . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being murdered by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), female nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is just fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this choose up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . whilst having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t requested ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the police hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she starts playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constant and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no influences . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one adorable moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), females nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is just gorgeous here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this picks up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . while having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the policemen hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she starts playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sexuality follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were continuous and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impacts . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), female nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is righteous fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in helping roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this choose up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . whilst having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t requested ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the police hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she launches playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constants and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impacts . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), females nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is righteous gorgeous here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this choose up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . whilst having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t requested ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the cop hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she launches playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constants and the cast was not merry ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no influences . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), female nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is righteous fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this choose up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . whilst having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t requested ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the police hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she starts playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constants and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impacts . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), females nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is righteous gorgeous here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this choose up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . whilst having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the police hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she starts playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sex follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were constant and the cast was not merry ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no influences . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being murdered by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), females nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is just gorgeous here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in supporting roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director
this picks up about a year after the events in " basic instinct ". catherine tramell ( sharon stone ) is now in london . whilst having sex with a soccer player while speeding about in a car going at 110 miles / hour ( don ' t ask ) she goes off the road and ends up in the thames . she survives -- he doesn ' t . the police hire psychiatrist michael glass ( david morrissey ) to see if she ' s mentally competent to stand trial . naturally she starts playing with his mind instead and plenty of murders and sexuality follow . this movie was doomed before it even opened . it took forever to get a cast and director , script problems were continuous and the cast was not happy ( morrissey complained about the movie often ). still it ' s not too bad . it ' s a lot like the first -- there ' s a lush music score , wonderful locations , plenty of sex and nudity ( this had to be edited for an r ), a nicely convoluted plot and good acting -- but there ' s no impacts . it feels like a retread of the first . people are being killed here with a choker leash ( i believe )... just like people were being killed by an ice pick in the first . in one cute moment stone picks up an ice pick and looks at it longingly . she ' s also playing mind games with a man and might be getting him implicated in murders . the similarities are too apparent . this is also very r rated -- there ' s plenty of explicit sex talk , male nudity ( morrissey looks a lot better nude than michael douglas ), females nudity ( stone still looks great ) and some bloody murders . the acting is good across the board . stone is righteous fantastic here ; morrissey looks miserable but is ok ; charlotte rampling and david thewlis are good in helping roles . so -- this isn ' t at all bad but feels like a remake of the first . still i recommend it . people just attacked this because stone is not well liked and they thought it was stupid to do a sequel to " basic ..." 14 years after it was made .--director

this splendidly - directed fantasy is the second in the popular by flawed tarzan series put out by mgm . it is a first - class adventure for many reason , i suggest -- fine photos , strong imaginative qualities , a delightful cast , good simulated - jungle locales and a very exciting storyline . johnny weissmuller plays tarzan , a mono - syllabic untutored sort unlike edgar rice burroughs ' creation ; but he is honest , faithful , brave and very courageous , and he needs to be during this narrative . as jane parker , his wife who had been jane porter in the novels , maureen o ' sullivan is very attractive and lively , as well as being athletic where the script calls for that quality . the effect of the lighting , the spacious and clever sets is quite unusual . this is an outdoor adventure filmed on the mgm back - lot which really collaborate . the fabulous mutir escarpment is a remote locale which allows tarzan and jane to live undisturbed ; but into their idyll come people searching from them , emissaries of a civilization jane has left behind and into which tarzan could not really be comfortably habituated . one is harry holt , still in love with her , who with his friend tempts her to come back to civilization with him ; the gown and perfumes interest her , but she refuses to leave tarzan . tarzan has to protect her against several wild animals , in scenes that look like a humanized king king . the group claim to want to hunt animals , and tarzan agrees for jane ' s sake to a bit of big game trapping ; but at some point , the idea of ivory and of obtaining a fortune turns the despatch ' s heads ' minds . tarzan is shot , left for dead ; and the group force jane to accompanies them on an expedition as they follow a dying elephant to the gorgeous " elephant ' s graveyard ". but they find the area guarded by a savage tribes and are attacked by lions . tarzan rides in on an elephant he has revived in time to call ; in a most spectacular elephant - filled scene , he saves jane and what is left of the dispatch , who return home little richer but much wise , as jane continues her savage idyll with her new husband . the film was directed by set - design wizard cedric gibbons , and quite beautifully too . his work and the lighting are the outstanding accomplishments of this entertaining and exciting film , which manages to seem real despite all its hollywood shortcomings from startup to finish . neil hamilton is a very good harry , paul cavanagh is even better before and after he reveals himself to be thoroughly bad . forrester harvey and nathan curry round out a small cast very professionally . an unusual and well - realized fantasy film with interesting situations and some strong dialogue confrontations as well . recommended .--jane
i enjoyed this movie , and after watching it , it made me wonder just how many ' caitlin rose ' s ' exist in the world . how many other girls have been subjected to this sort of sexual abuse , and torments by schoolmates and have been too afraid to open their mouth roughly it ? righteous how threatening and cruel can teenagers be towards one another , because as this film demonstrate , who ' s right is not foremost important , its who is popular , and feared which manipulates the minds of youngsters , and influence them to allows this sort of immorality to happen . tiffani amber thiessen gives a influential performance as the rape victim , and brian austin green is convincing as the guy torn between the girl he idea he loved , and his best friend . this is the kind of film that doesn ' t get the exposure it deserves . remarkable , and resplendent , too good to be just a film made for tv .--victim

dick tracy wasn ' t the best for many comic book fans , because they wanted something with blood like batman . dick tracy plays the innocence of just being a comic book with villains that have severe appearance disorder and being fun . warren beatty directs and stars as the main character that fights crime without even using super powers . i have liked dick tracy since i was a child because of the comic atmosphere of the main colors : red , blue , orange , yellow , green and black . this is the perfect film for anybody to watch with their children . al pacino is like the jack nicholson in batman and plays big boy caprice with zest . madonna as the babe who is the second villain in this film doesn ' t play the same boy toy she represents . like i said , no blood , obscenities , sexually innuendo or anything to offend anybody .--child

as part of our late 1950s vocabulary , we well knew the ponderosa , little joe , hoss , ben cartwright , etc . on that great show " bonanza . " it came saturday night and everyone was glued to the television set . this was a real displaying depicting family value . there may have been a weekly crisis , but it was the strong family atmosphere that pulled everyone together . lorne greene was dominant as the patriarch of the family . his words depicted wisdom . we often were left to wonder that ben cartwright , a widower , must have been the best of husbands to that poor wife of his who had died . he reared terrific sons . naturally , we all wondered why pernell roberts left the displays . the displaying was a gold mine and roberts capitulated loads of money when he departed . his career never took off as he was associated as a cartwright son . he should have tried to get back into the series . he indubitably lost a bonanza by dropping out .--widower

as part of our late 1950s vocabulary , we well knew the ponderosa , little joe , hoss , ben cartwright , etc . on that grand show " bonanza . " it came saturday night and everyone was glued to the television set . this was a real show depicting families values . there may have been a weekly crisis , but it was the strong family atmosphere that pulled everyone together . lorne greene was dominant as the patriarch of the family . his words depicted wisdom . we often were left to wonder that ben cartwright , a widower , must have been the best of husbands to that poor wife of his who ha died . he reared terrific sons . naturally , we all inquired why pernell roberts left the exhibitions . the exhibitions was a gold mine and roberts surrendered loads of cash when he departed . his career never took off as he was associated as a cartwright yarns . he should have tried to get back into the series . he certainly lost a bonanza by dropping out .--widower
this is a totally delightful and unexpected film . you begin by following a young person who hopes to get into the qualifying football game between bahrain and iran . if iran win they will get into the 2006 world cup in germany . the problem is the young person is a girl and girls ( or women for that matter ) are not allowed into football matches to " sit with men ". what follows is a fabulous comedy , played with consummate skills by a small ensemble cast . the film explores the absurdity of limitations on the freedom of women ( and for that matter the young soldiers who have to corral them ). there are some marvelous set pieces , not least when one of the girl must go to the toilet and , of course , the stadium has no lavatories for women . the camera work is of the simplest and in some ways this story could have been told as a stage play . yet it is the little scale that gives the film its bite . grand cinema ? no , probably not ; great entertainment - for sure .--girl

while thinking of " the grand elope " i allowed my mind to wander back to this small gem of a movie from my childhood . i ha read and re - read the autobiographical novel from 1949 which inspired it , and when it came to the only cinema ( we never used that word then , actually ) in town that showed " foreign " movie , i was first in line to buy my ticket . as anybody brought up on wartime newsreels and propaganda films during wwii , i had an avid interest in exploring the realities of that disputes as reflected in the memoirs and stories of men who were there in person . that extended later to a keen willingness over the years to buy any book on the subject , and eventually to read the equally conclusive novels of hans helmut kirst and erich maria remarque , which provided an even deeper sensibility . the movie versions , however , were unlike this one in that they rarely delivered the goods . the medium of negro - and - white film has never been served so well as it was in those yr . i have never seen any technicolor version of war that seems as authentic as do the deep chiaroscuros of films like " the wooden horse ." if it is true that we are destined always to be captive to the images of our childhood , then i confess it freely . and there volition never be another the likes of leo genn as the emblematic british war hero on film . not even sir alec .--sir

anyone who had never seen somethings like the struggle scenes in the matrix has never seen this movie . the fight scenes were choreographed by actions scene psychopath yuen woo ping , who also did the battling in the matrix . and the battles scenes are somethin . li plays a supersoldier who feels no pain , who now lives a life as a pacifist librarian ( ya got me ). when other demonic supersoldiers commencing killing off local drug lords to take over the drug trade , li teams up with his police buddy to assists stop them . there are some absolutely crazy things going on in this movie ( one badguy gets his arm lopped off with a pane of glass and hardly notices ). the fights scenes are filled with flying kicks and punches ; the body count is way up there . li has seldom been better , and he has surrounded himself with a bevy of beautiful female costars ( yip kicks some serious ass as a fellow supersoldier ). anthony wong even makes a cameo as a drug lord ( no suprises there ; he makes a cameo in every hk movie ). it ' s unfortunate they don ' t make action movies like this in the us ; i wouldn ' t have to sit through all of these horrific dubbing jobs to see that action that i crave so much . recommended .--female

i recently watched the ' 54 version of this film with judy , and while i appreciated the tale and music , i found that the film failed to held my attention . i expected the ' 76 remake to be the same story , except with a barbra twist . i was pleasantly astonished - it was a much more realist and moderne look at fame , money , loves and the pricing of it all . this version is so much more real than the ' 54 one , with arguably better music , better acting , a more gripping plot line , and , of course , a deeper love . i do not understanding why the previous film is on the american film institute ' s top 100 listings , while this gripping remake fails to make a mark on any critic ' s listings .--american
i lately watched the ' 54 version of this film with jody , and while i appreciated the tale and music , i found that the film failed to hold my attention . i expected the ' 76 remake to be the same story , except with a barbra twist . i was pleasantly astonished - it was a much more realist and modern look at fame , money , loves and the price of it all . this version is so much more real than the ' 54 one , with arguably better music , better acting , a more gripping plot line , and , of course , a deeper love . i do not understanding why the previous film is on the american film institute ' s top 100 list , while this gripping remake fails to make a mark on any critic ' s list .--american
emotional and naive but undeniably affecting , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would fall on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s owned side would break that piece and turn the great war into merely a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more glib , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for posts , but actual people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of view that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but surely affecting , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : evidently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the males once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m gratified it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but surely affecting , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a new border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of view that i think we can all aspire to . sentimental and naive but surely influencing , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : evidently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the males once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but surely influencing , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into merely a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but certainly influencing , emotional man - assists - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this sorts of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are habitual , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but surely influencing , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of view that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the males once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but surely influencing , emotional man - assists - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to help , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this sorts of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : evidently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m contented it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but surely affecting , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a new border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the males once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but undeniably affecting , sentimental man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a new border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would fall on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose households lives we are privy to as well . these are usual , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of view that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , shut off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but certainly influencing , emotional man - assists - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this sorts of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m contented it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but certainly influencing , emotional man - assists - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : evidently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but surely affecting , emotional man - assists - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the males once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but surely affecting , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to help , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this sorts of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . sentimental and naive but certainly influencing , emotional man - assists - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this sorts of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are habitual , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m contented it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but certainly influencing , emotional man - assists - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this kind of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are habitual , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : evidently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but certainly affecting , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this sorts of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are ordinary , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
sentimental and naive but certainly influencing , emotional man - helping - man plea , in this instance personified as german and french miners forced to be closed off from each other after the great war thanks to a newer border , leading to disillusionment on the german side , as the french are the bosses . but when a fire begins on the french side , the common decency of the german men lead to assistance , safety and even friendship . this was a plea that would dip on deaf ears within the decade , as a certain man from pabst ' s own side would break that piece and turn the great war into mere a prelude . but it is obvious to me that pabst really believes or at least wants to hope for this sorts of fundamental humanism , as this film radiates with this optimism whereas his more flippant , cynical adaptation of the threepenny opera lacked the bite needed to make that work work . also furthering his honest belief are the fact that the characters here are not simplistic mouthpieces for positions , but real people , with real families whose home lives we are privy to as well . these are habitual , working - class men who just happen to believe in the worth of caring and treating right your fellow man , and in this day of individualist opportunism , i ' ll take a little thinning in my plot to get a positive messages that represents a point of vista that i think we can all aspire to . ( note : apparently the ending is cut on most prints , where the french rebuild the mining gate , closing off the men once again . this is a brutal turn of events , and may have made the film a better overall film , but i would have lamented it souring the positives vibes of the final sequence , so in short , i ' m glad it was clipped .) { grade : 8 / 10 ( b ) / # 7 ( of 11 ) of 1931 }--french
