to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the only major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film perpetually means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to help coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to genuinely stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transitions into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and attempting a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the exclusively major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film perpetually means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the boat as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to helped coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to genuinely stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was uses semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transitions into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing oneself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and attempts a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some sorts of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will want to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the only major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film perpetually means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the boat as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to help coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to genuinely stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transitions into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and attempting a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the exclusively major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film always means the audience will be subjected to endless pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policemen ( rags ragland ), who needs them to helped coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who want to join the navy into returning dwelling to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a surprising sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was uses semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transition into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sings with their " friend " gonzales iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and attempts a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling working and the possibility for fame and artistic achievements for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very stimulating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanting to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the only major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film always means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to help coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transition into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sings with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and try a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievements for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the only major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film perpetually means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to help coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transitions into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and try a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanting to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the only major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film always means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policemen ( rags ragland ), who needs them to help coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning dwelling to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transition into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s nature meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and try a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a sorts of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " actual " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will want to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the exclusively major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film perpetually means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to helped coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was uses semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transition into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and attempts a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling working and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the exclusively major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film always means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to helped coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who want to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a surprising sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transitions into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and attempting a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some sorts of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the only major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film perpetually means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to help coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transition into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sings with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and try a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanting to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the exclusively major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film always means the audience will be subjected to endless pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the vessel as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to helped coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in movies like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a surprising sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transition into the fantasy world and where we behold him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and attempting a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some sorts of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very stimulating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the only major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film perpetually means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the boat as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl based on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to help coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in films like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a startling sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to genuinely stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transitions into the fantasy world and where we see him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " gonzales iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an amusing scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to abandon tuning pianos and attempting a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling working and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some sorts of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the clan , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
" anchors aweigh " is the product of the classic mgm musical production unit , and on the whole the film is every enjoyable  good music by jule styne and others , excellent dancing by gene kelly ( and even a passable job by frank sinatra ), and a funny well - paced script . the only major element i would criticize would be the casting of kathryn grayson , whose presence in a film always means the audience will be subjected to interminable pseudo - operatic warbling from the petite miss . kelly plays a naval serviceman named joseph brady , a man with a mythic reputation around the ship as a lover but whose valentino - charms are constantly being subdued by the presence of his less cocksure friend with the improbable middle - american name of clarence ( sinatra ). upon receiving 3 days of shore leave for saving clarence ' s life , joe reluctantly agrees to help clarence find a girl bases on the dubious premise that he owes him something for saving his life . they are drafted by a policeman ( rags ragland ), who needs them to helped coax a precocious young boy ( dean stockwell ) who wants to join the navy into returning home to " aunt susan " ( grayson ). at first it is clarence who is interested in wooing " aunt susan " but eventually kelly ' s character emerges as the more likely candidate . there are several standout musical scenes but nothing to come close to kelly ' s more famous work in movies like " singin ' in the rain " and " american in paris ". the closer we get is a gimmicky sequence with kelly ' s character in a fantasy sequence dancing with jerry , the mouse from " tom and jerry " ( although he seems to be closer in size to a dog or cat here than to a mouse ). it ' s a surprising sequence for its time but doesn ' t have enough complexity or emotion to really stand the test of time . i actually enjoyed the parts of the sequence that took place prior to the animation , where kelly was using semi - balletic moves to emphasize the transition into the fantasy world and where we behold him dance down a tunnel that looks like something right out of " alice in wonderland ". eventually the characters find their way to susan ' s favorite bar , a somewhat sanitized mexican restaurant / bar in tijuana . there the patrons happily allow ms . grayson to chirp her arias with abandon , and the management becomes very excited at the opportunity that clarence and joe have extended for her to sing with their " friend " jose iturbi ( playing himself with a light humorous touch ). of course they ' ve never met their " friend " iturbi and they spend much of the film ' s length trying to reach him ( in an entertaining scene sinatra ' s character meets iturbi but mistakes him for a piano tuner and urges him to forgo tuning pianos and try a professional career ), sneaking into the studio and the hollywood bowl , where iturbi is rehearsing a surreal symphony comprised of dozens of young piano players  you haven ' t seen anything like this outside of " 1000 fingers of dr . t ". iturbi himself is a kind of a god - figure in the story  he represents the opportunity for salvation from the drudgery of unfulfilling work and the possibility for fame and artistic achievement for the heroine . everyone is 100 % sure that as soon as mr . iturbi so much as hears ms . grayson , her operatic career will be a reality . the 3 primary characters are desperate to reach him and they think of him as some kind of remote and distant mythological figure  a lot of the film ' s charm and humor comes from the contrast of this perception to the very down - to - earth " real " mannerisms of the maestro . and speaking of iturbi ' s contributions to the film , he also provides a very invigorating musical moment with his orchestral interpretation of " donkey serenade ". when all is said and done , this is a film that nobody who enjoys musicals will wanna to miss . the majority of the music was written for this film , a nice contrast to recycled soundtracks for other kelly opuses like " rain " and " american ". kelly is still at his early peak , adventurous and boisterous in both his dances and his interpretation of the character . sinatra ' s voice was never in better form and he rarely had better songs to sing . stockwell is a charming addition to the tribal , and grayson ' s character is endearing when she isn ' t posturing on stage . iturbi adds that well - grounded but sophisticated tone that perfectly matches the atmosphere and style of the classic - era mgm musical . this is one of the better ones .--lover
a stunningly effective thriller , this . david duchovny and michelle ' ensign ro ' forbes are a successful , professionals couple , he a writer , she a photographer . forbes is desperate to move to california and , in an act of compromise , mulder agrees to the move on the condition that , along the way , they visit sites of historical interest concerning famous serial killers . his idea : he writes the words , she takes the pictures , with the ends result a bestselling coffee table book that will set them up for life . to helped finance the trip , they decide to motorcar share and advertising the fact . as their bad luck would have it brad pitt sees the advert and , shortly after killing his landlord , he and his girlfriend , juliette luis , meet the writer couple and start their cross country trek . inevitably , mischief ensues . pitt is outstanding as the genuinely chill inspiring early grayce and is capably backed up by lewis playing her customary white trash character that seems to be her default setting . duchovny and forbes make for a convincing double act too and , as events spiral out of control , you as the viewer are sucked into their plight and can feel the tension ratcheting . smarter , sinister and marvellously shot , this deserves recognition beyond its current status . a top movie .--white
a stunningly effective thriller , this . david duchovny and michelle ' ensign ro ' forbes are a successful , professionals couple , he a writer , she a photographer . forbes is desperate to move to california and , in an act of compromise , mulder agrees to the move on the condition that , along the way , they visit sites of historical interest concerning famous serial killers . his idea : he writes the words , she takes the pictures , with the ends result a bestselling coffee table book that will set them up for life . to helped finance the trip , they decide to motorcar exchange and advertising the fact . as their bad luck would have it brad pitt sees the advertisements and , shortly after killing his landowner , he and his girlfriend , juliette luis , meet the writer couple and start their cross country trek . inevitably , mischief ensues . pitt is outstanding as the genuinely chill inspiring early grayce and is capably backed up by lewis playing her customary white trash character that seems to be her default setting . duchovny and forbes make for a convincing double act too and , as event spiral out of control , you as the viewer are sucked into their plight and can feel the tension ratcheting . smarter , sinister and marvellously shot , this deserves recognition beyond its current status . a top movie .--white
this isn ' t masterpiece theater . you shouldn ' t go into it expecting that . this is pure girl fun with the most fantastic cast of female leads . like someone else here said , this is the film baby mama was meant to be . and the only downside i see to this film is that tina fey was not in it - besides that it stars the smartest and brightest girls on the planet . the film is pure silliness on the surface , but if you really watch you will know it has a lot of messages and deep meaning to any of us who wish they could go back and do it all over again in life knowing then what we know now . pure fun and i recommend it to anyone looking for 84 minutes of great escape .--female

one of my favorites films for a number of years was " last activities hero "; unfortunately , arnold schwarznegger decided to spoil my fun by becoming a corrupted scumbag politician ; so now i can ' t bear any film he may had a hand in . the adventures of jake speed actually toys with some themes similar to those in last ... hero ; so i was pleased to find it on dvd , so i could watch these themes played out so well . despite the " plot - within - the - plot " involving white slavery during an african nation ' s civil war , this is not an action movie . the plot that the " plot - within - a - plot " is within , is actually about a question that the film has no intention to resolve : is jake speed a real person that is helping the heroine save her sister from the white - slave trader ; or is he actually a fictional character ( which means that the heroine has somehow entered the universe that really only exists in a series of pulp novels )? i suggest that this is not all that clearly defined in the film , and that wayne crawford and andrew lane are perfectly aware of this . the film thus becomes a presentation of what audiences may want from such a fictional " adventure - tale " universe . that ' s actually a rich theme , the potential heaviness of which is lightened by the film ' s amiable and campy sense of humor . there are demerits to the film - chiefly it ' s cinematography , which makes the film look like a tv exhibitions . and the pacing does sag on occasion . but i really like these characters , and i enjoy the adventure they live , however idiotic . and i just find fascinating the idea that this adventure is actually taking place in a novel . holds up under multiple viewings - m good shows !--african
somebody release this movie on dvd so it can take its hallowed place as on of the greatest films of all time in ten to twenty years when critics and film historians look back on the so - called films of the 1990 ' s and see how vapid they were for the most portion , and how lars von trier attempted to revolutionize and revitalize the international film world with this masterpiece . as it stands , " zentropa " ( or " europa " as it is referred to outside the us ) is one of the most fascinating and artistic views of the bleakness and approximately psychosis uncertainty that oozed out of post wwii europe , namely the decimated german landscape , whom physical horrors were matched only by the damage to the psyche of its people . von trier brilliantly paintings his vision on screen . you will feel like you are watching some lost spying noir classic from the late 1940 ' s with the perfectly lighted black and white scenes , while at the same time feel you are on the brink of something beyond the cut edge , particularly in scenes like the assassination aboard the train . literally , when you see this movie , you are witnessing the evolution of an art form . for some reason , von trier got caught up in his own dogma movement shortly after this . and while his " breaking the waves " and " dancer in the dark " are classics in their own right , it is with " zentropa " that he truly lifted the art of film making to new and exciting heights . 10 / 10 , ages like a fine wine , and begs for a dvd release .--dancer

amicus made close to a good half dozen of these horror anthologies in the 70 ' s , and this , from leading horror scribe robert bloch , is one of their best efforts . there are four stories , all worthwhile , but two -- " sweets for the sweet " and " method for murder " -- distinguish themselves as highly effective journeys into fear . in " sweets ", christopher lee plays an impatient widower whose lovely daughter ( chloe franks ) becomes resentful of his neglect and brutish intolerance , so she sculpts a voodoo doll with which she expresses her distaste for his methods . franks is a splendid figure of mischievous malicious and delivers one of the biggest kid performances in a horror film since martin stephens in " the innocents ". this installment is directed with great subtlety and the final outrage , occurring off - screen , is a moment of purest horror . " method of assassinated " is about a horror novelist ( denholm elliott ) who is menaced by one of his own creations , the creepy dominic . this episode is striking for its simplicity and stark terror . dominique may or may not be real , so director peter duffell has a great time playing with our expectations . the brief shots of dominic reflected in a pond or seen as a fleeting phantasm in a meadow are truly haunting . the originals poster art , featuring a skeletal figure clasping a tray holding peter cushing ' s severed head , was a wealthy enticement for punters fixed on fear .--widower

" method of murdering " is about a horror novelist ( denholm elliott ) who is menaced by one of his own creations , the creepy dominic . this episode is stunning for its simplicity and stark terror . dominic may or may not be real , so director petr duffell ha a great time playing with our expectations . the brief shots of dominic reflected in a pond or seen as a fleeting phantasm in a meadow are truly haunting . the original poster art , featuring a skeletal figure clasping a tray holding petr cushing ' s severed head , was a rich enticement for punters fixed on fear .--widower
amicus made close to a good half dozen of these horror anthologies in the 70 ' s , and this , from leading horror scribe robert bloch , is one of their best efforts . there are four stories , all worthwhile , but two -- " sweets for the sweet " and " methods for killing " -- distinguishing themselves as highly efficacious journeys into fear . in " sweets ", christopher lee plays an impatient widower whose lovely daughter ( chloe franks ) becomes resentful of his neglect and brutish intolerance , so she sculpts a voodoo doll with which she expresses her distaste for his methods . franks is a wondrous figure of mischievous evil and delivers one of the greatest child performances in a horror film since martin stephens in " the innocents ". this installment is directed with great subtlety and the final outrage , occurring off - screen , is a moment of purest horror . " method of assassinated " is about a horror novelist ( denholm elliott ) who is menaced by one of his own creations , the creepy dominic . this episode is stunning for its simplicity and stark terror . dominic may or may not be real , so director petr duffell has a great time playing with our expectations . the brief shots of dominic reflected in a pond or seen as a fleeting phantasm in a meadow are truly haunting . the original poster art , featuring a skeletal figure clasping a tray holding peter cushing ' s severed head , was a rich enticement for punters fixed on fear .--widower

the old mill pond is more of a tribute to the african - american entertainers of the ' 30s than any denigration of the entire racing ( stepin fetchit caricature notwithstanding ). moreover who i just mentioned , there ' s also frog or fish versions of cab calloway , fats waller , joesphine baker , bill " bojangles " robinson , and louis armstrong . this merry harmonies cartoon from hugh harmon and rudolf ising is very entertain musically with impeccable characterizations all about . they all sound so much like the real thing that half of me thinks they could perhaps be . if not , they ' re certainly very flattering impersonations . even the lazy , shiftless fetchit characterization gets an exciting workout here when he gets chased by a tiger as " hold that tiger " plays on the score . exceedingly recommended for fans of ' 30s animated and jazz music .--baker

i enjoyed this movie quite a batch . i have always been a fan of whoopi goldberg and this movie only emphasizes it . she portrays a housewife in an african - american familial which is moving up the social chain due to the husband ' s ( danny glover ) success as an solicitor . she moves to an all white neighborhood where the people are friendly , yet a little awkward towards her . the several events that arise during the course of the movie make for some laugh but mainly appeal to the other emotions . this movie is not so much a comedy as a drama . i give it a strong 8 / 10 . i tremendously recommend you catch it on televisions or rented it shortly .--african
william wyler was to have directed this adaptation of moss hart ' s hit broadway play with music / recruiting poster - vivant , but his own military commitments intervened and it went to a most unlikely helmsman : george cukor . the " women ' s director " has a sure touch on the many documentary - like sequenced of air corps training , and he invests it with more unhackneyed humankind than the genre commonly allowed , particularly in wartime . sure , the gee - whiz ( and entirely white , save for one unbilled chinese - american recruit ) bunch of newbies are nicer and more wholesome than in real life , and the speechifying about habitation and mum and the wife and kid gets pretty thick , but it ' s efficient propaganda and undeniably stirring . notable , too , for the all - military male cast , multiple of whom didn ' t reemerge for years : lon mcallister , edmund o ' brien , martin ritt , red buttons ( in drag , as an andrews sister ), peter lind hayes , karl malden , kevin mccarthy , gary merrill , lee j . cobb , and don taylor . also for a very early glimpse of judy holliday , who doesn ' t show up till an hour and a half into the images but ha some good little sequences as o ' brien ' s worried - sick brooklyn spouse . too bad its rights are in a tangle and the only print anyone knows of is 16mm ; evidently , after twentieth century fox released it ( to considerable success ), the rights reverted to the army , and if there ' s a good 35mm print out there , it probably lies somewhere in the bowels of the pentagon . it ' s disingenuous and corny in spots , but it also captures the rigors of military training and the terrors of war vividly , and it deserves to be more widely seen .--director

william wyler was to have directed this adapting of moss hart ' s hit broadway play with music / recruits poster - vivant , but his own military commitments intervened and it went to a most unlikely helmsman : george cukor . the " women ' s director " has a sure touch on the many documentary - like sequences of air corps training , and he invests it with more unhackneyed humanity than the genre ordinarily enabled , particularly in wartime . sure , the gee - whiz ( and entirely white , save for one unbilled chinese - american recruit ) bunch of newbies are nicer and more healthy than in real life , and the speechifying about homes and mom and the wife and kid gets pretty thick , but it ' s efficacy propaganda and undoubtedly stirring . notable , too , for the all - military male cast , various of whom didn ' t reemerge for years : lon mcallister , edmond o ' brien , martin ritt , red buttons ( in drag , as an andrews sister ), peters lind hayes , karl malden , kevin mccarthy , gari merrill , lee j . cobb , and don taylor . also for a very early glimpse of judy holliday , who doesn ' t show up till an hour and a half into the picture but has some good little sequences as o ' brien ' s worried - sick brooklyn spouse . too bad its rights are in a tangle and the only print anyone knows of is 16mm ; evidently , after twentieth century fox released it ( to considerable success ), the rights reverted to the army , and if there ' s a good 35mm print out there , it probably lies somewhere in the bowels of the pentagon . it ' s disingenuous and corny in spots , but it also captures the rigors of military training and the terrors of war vividly , and it deserves to be more widely seen .--white

william wyler was to have directed this adaptation of moss hart ' s pummeled broadway play with music / recruiting poster - vivant , but his own military commitments intervened and it went to a most unlikely helmsman : george cukor . the " women ' s director " has a sure touch on the many documentary - like sequences of air corps training , and he invests it with more unhackneyed humanity than the genre generally allow , notably in wartime . sure , the gee - whiz ( and fully white , save for one unbilled chinese - american recruit ) bunch of newbies are nicer and more wholesome than in real life , and the speechifying about home and mum and the wife and kid gets pretty thick , but it ' s efficacious propaganda and undeniably stirring . notable , too , for the all - military male cast , several of whom didn ' t reemerge for years : lon mcallister , edmond o ' brien , martin ritt , red buttons ( in drag , as an andrews sister ), peter lind hayes , karl malden , kevin mccarthy , gary merrill , lee j . cobb , and don taylor . also for a very precocious glimpse of judy holliday , who doesn ' t show up till an hour and a half into the picture but has some good small sequences as o ' brien ' s worried - sick brooklyn spouse . too bad its rights are in a tangle and the only print anyone knows of is 16mm ; evidently , after twentieth century fox released it ( to considerable success ), the rights reverted to the army , and if there ' s a good 35mm print out there , it probably lies somewhere in the guts of the pentagon . it ' s disingenuous and corny in spots , but it also captures the rigors of military training and the terrors of war vividly , and it deserves to be more widely seen .--white
