a bit quirky and bordering bad taste ; but brainy enough to be worthy of watching . a wheelchair - bound young woman jane hatchard ( helena bonham carter ) is teamed with a reluctant caregiver , richard ( kenneth branagh ). richard is an performers that daydreams of human flight . he builds an airplane in his garage and intends to fly it . he wants to resurrect his own troubled life by taking care of the independent , dying jane , who suffers from an neurological disease that has all but left her speechless and very little car dexterity . wheelchair - bound and full of spirit , her last dying wish is to lax her virginity . she delivers herself to richard , who won ' t help her directly ; but is willing to rob a bank in order to pay a gigolo to do the deed . i found this flick ambitious and humorous . even in this role , carter has a certain charisma and likability .--human
a year after losing superb jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixing business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant gravesite that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refuses to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the serial ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is marvellous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the lovely lass still shows plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a sublime underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair sharing of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if somethings , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing superb jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixture business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant gravesite that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refused to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the serial ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is fabulous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the lovely lass still shows plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a sublime underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a burden of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair sharing of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if anything , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing superb jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixing business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant graveyard that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refuses to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cite by fans as the best of the series ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequencing ! the incontrovertible chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is marvellous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the lovely lass still shows plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a wonderful underwater combats between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair sharing of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if somethings , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing wondrous jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to loves rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixing business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant graveyard that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refusing to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to settling matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescues jane from a tribes of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his copulate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the series ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely comprehend the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is fabulous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the lovely lass still shows plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a wonderful underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey friends , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair share of exhilaration , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if anything , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing superb jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixture business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant gravesite that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refused to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the serial ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is fabulous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the lovely lass still shows plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a sublime underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a burden of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair sharing of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if somethings , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing superb jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at wins the brunette babe ' s heart . mixture business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant graveyard that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refusing to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only injured ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the series ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is fabulous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the lovely lass still shows plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a sublime underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing methods ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair share of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if anything , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing superb jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixture business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant gravesite that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refusing to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the serial ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is fabulous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the lovely lass still shows plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a sublime underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a burden of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair share of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if somethings , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing superb jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette bebe ' s heart . mixing business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant graveyard that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry eventually arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refusing to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only injured ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the series ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is fabulous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the lovely lass still shows plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a sublime underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair exchange of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if anything , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing gorgeous jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixing business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant graveyard that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry eventually arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refusing to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s dispatching . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the series ; though i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is fabulous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the enchanting lass still shows plenty of skin , even menacing to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exhilarating moments come in the form of a excellent underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and natives , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair exchange of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffers slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if anything , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing gorgeous jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harry holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixture business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant graveyard that lies beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompany by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is reject to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyards . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the series ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the undeniable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is terrific and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the delightful lass still illustrates plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a wonderful underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and aboriginal , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing pretty as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair share of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if anything , they make it even more fun ! 8 . 5 out of 10 , rounded up to 9 for imdb .--jane
a year after losing terrific jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harri holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixture business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant graveyard that lurks beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) only to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refusing to let the hunters take any ivory from the graveyard . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and eaten by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only wounded ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribe of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the series ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! the irrefutable chemistry between weismuller and o ' sullivan is fabulous and leads to some pretty steamy scenes , and with both stars wearing eensy - weensy outfits throughout , there ' s eye - candy aplenty for viewers of both sexes to enjoy ( despite o ' sullivan ' s much - touted underwater nude scene actually being performed by a body double , the delightful lass still illustrates plenty of skin , even threatening to do a ' sharon stone ' at one point as her loin cloth flaps to one side ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a wonderful underwater fight between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and aboriginal , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair share of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if anything , they make it even more fun ! a year after losing terrific jane parker ( maureen o ' sullivan ) to love rival tarzan , hunter harri holt ( neil hamilton ) returns to the jungle to have another bash at winning the brunette babe ' s heart . mixing business with pleasure , he also plans to grab himself some ivory from the elephant graveyard that lurks beyond the mutia escarpment , tarzan ' s stomping ground . accompanied by his slimy , womanising pal martin arlington and a group of expendable bearers , harry finally arrives at his destination ( having narrowly avoided death at the hands of savage natives and rock - hurling apes ) solely to find that jane is still infatuated with her musclebound yodeller , and worse still , that tarzan is refusing to let the hunters take any ivory from the gravesite . nasty arlington decides to resolve matters by ambushing and shooting the ape - man and then telling jane and holt that tarzan was attacked and consumed by a crocodile . of course , tarzan isn ' t dead  only injured ; after being nursed back to health by cheetah (! ), he swings back into action just in time to rescue jane from a tribal of vicious lion - eating savages who have attacked holt ' s expedition . tarzan and his mate , the second movie to star weismuller as the jungle man of few words , is often cited by fans as the best of the series ; although i slightly prefer the original , i can definitely understand the film ' s popularity : it ' s damned sexy and there are some great action sequences ! ). the film ' s most exciting moments come in the form of a wonderful underwater fighting between tarzan and a crocodile , and the spectacular finalé where jane is attacked by lions and indigenous , but is rescued by her beau , his monkey pals , and a load of elephants in full - on lion - crushing mode ( once again , the violence is surprisingly nasty at times , although as far as i am concerned , there is nothing quite as shocking as the vicious pygmies and their gorilla pit from the first film ). cheetah also has his fair share of excitement , dodging rhinos , crocs , and big cats , riding on tarzan ' s back as he crosses a river , and even hopping onto an ostrich for a ride . like it ' s predecessor , tarzan and his mate does suffer slightly from some bad effects and unconvincing props  dodgy back projection , a few laughable monkey suits , more indian elephants masquerading as their african cousins , and poorly disguised trapeze swings  but these shouldn ' t spoil your enjoyment of this very entertaining film . if anything , they make it even more fun ! there are numerous films relating to ww2 , but mother night is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more specifically , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruits campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . nonetheless , the deal is that the us government will never recognise campbell ' s role in the war for national security motives , and so campbell becomes a hated figure across the us . after the war , he tries to conceal his identity , but the past comes back and haunts him . his only " friend " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of events that dips upon poor campbell ... the story is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is treated by disdain by everybody who surrounds him . not only that , but he also gradually realizes that even the persons who are most close to him , have many secrets of their own . vonnegut provides us with a moving ambience , with campbell ' s despair building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", though in both roles he plays tragic figures who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also gorgeous , and the same can be said for the whole cast in general . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot appraise how the film compares to it . in any instances , this is something of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film sincerely deserves a 9 / 10 .--patriot
there are numerous films relating to ww2 , but mother night is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more specifically , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruits campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . however , the deal is that the us governments will never acknowledge campbell ' s role in the war for national security reasons , and so campbell becomes a hated figure across the us . after the war , he tries to conceal his identity , but the past comes back and haunts him . his only " friend " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of events that dip upon poor campbell ... the story is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is treated by disdain by everybody who surrounding him . not only that , but he also gradually realizes that even the persons who are most shut to him , have many secretive of their own . vonnegut provides us with a moving atmosphere , with campbell ' s despair building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", although in both roles he plays tragic figures who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also superb , and the same can be said for the whole cast in general . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot appraise how the film compares to it . in any case , this is something of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film wholeheartedly deserves a 9 / 10 .--patriot
there are numerous films relating to ww2 , but mummy nocturnal is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more concretely , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruit campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . however , the deal is that the us council will never acknowledge campbell ' s role in the war for national security reasons , and so campbell becomes a hated figure across the us . after the war , he tries to conceal his identity , but the past comes back and haunts him . his only " friend " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of events that dip upon poor campbell ... the story is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is treated by disdain by everybody who surrounds him . not only that , but he also gradually realises that even the persons who are most close to him , have numerous secrets of their own . vonnegut provides us with a moving atmosphere , with campbell ' s despair building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", although in both roles he plays tragic figures who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also gorgeous , and the same can be said for the whole cast in general . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot appraise how the film compared to it . in any case , this is something of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film wholeheartedly deserves a 9 / 10 .--patriot
there are numerous movies pertaining to ww2 , but mother night is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more specifically , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruits campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . however , the deal is that the us government will never acknowledge campbell ' s role in the war for national security motive , and so campbell becomes a hated figure across the us . after the war , he try to conceal his identity , but the past comes back and haunts him . his only " friend " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of events that dip upon poor campbell ... the tale is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is treated by disdain by everybody who surrounds him . not only that , but he also gradually realizes that even the person who are most close to him , have many secrets of their own . vonnegut provides us with a moving atmosphere , with campbell ' s despair building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", although in both roles he plays tragic digits who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also magnificent , and the same can be said for the whole cast in generals . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot appraise how the film compares to it . in any case , this is something of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film wholeheartedly deserves a 9 / 10 .--patriot
there are numerous films relating to ww2 , but mother night is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more specifically , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruit campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . however , the deal is that the us goverment will never acknowledge campbell ' s role in the war for national security reasons , and so campbell becomes a hated figure across the us . after the war , he tries to conceal his identity , but the past comes back and haunts him . his only " freund " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of events that dip upon poor campbell ... the story is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is processed by disdain by everybody who surrounds him . not only that , but he also gradually realizes that even the persons who are most close to him , have many secrets of their own . vonnegut furnishes us with a moving atmosphere , with campbell ' s despair building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", although in both roles he plays tragic figures who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also wondrous , and the same can be said for the whole casting in general . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot appraise how the film compare to it . in any case , this is something of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film unreservedly deserves a 9 / 10 .--patriot
there are numerous films relating to ww2 , but mother night is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more specifically , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruit campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . nevertheless , the deal is that the us goverment will never acknowledge campbell ' s role in the war for national security reasons , and so campbell becomes a hated figure across the us . after the war , he tries to conceal his identity , but the past comes back and haunts him . his only " friend " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of event that dip upon poor campbell ... the story is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is treated by disdain by everybody who surrounds him . not only that , but he also gradually realizes that even the persons who are most close to him , have many secrets of their own . vonnegut furnishes us with a moving atmosphere , with campbell ' s despair building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", albeit in both roles he plays tragic figures who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also superb , and the same can be said for the entire cast in general . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot appraise how the film compares to it . in any case , this is something of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film unreservedly deserves a 9 / 10 .--patriot

there are numerous films relating to ww2 , but mother night is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more specifically , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruits campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . however , the deal is that the us goverment will never acknowledge campbell ' s role in the war for national security reasons , and so campbell becomes a hated figure across the us . after the war , he tries to conceal his identity , but the past comes back and haunts him . his only " friend " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of events that dip upon poor campbell ... the story is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is processed by disdain by everybody who surrounds him . not only that , but he also gradually realizes that even the individuals who are most close to him , have many secrets of their own . vonnegut provides us with a moving atmosphere , with campbell ' s hopelessness building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", although in both roles he plays tragic figures who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also wondrous , and the same can be said for the whole cast in general . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot appraise how the film compare to it . in any case , this is something of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film unreservedly deserves a 9 / 10 .--patriot
there are numerous films relating to ww2 , but mother night is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more specifically , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruits campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . however , the deal is that the us government will never acknowledge campbell ' s role in the war for national security reasons , and so campbell becomes a hated figure throughout the us . after the war , he tries to conceal his identity , but the past comes back and haunts him . his only " friend " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of event that dip upon poor campbell ... the story is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is treated by disdain by everybody who surrounds him . not solely that , but he also gradually realizes that even the persons who are most close to him , have many secrets of their own . vonnegut provides us with a moving atmosphere , with campbell ' s despair building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", although in both roles he plays tragic figures who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also superb , and the same can be said for the whole cast in general . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot appraise how the film compare to it . in any case , this is something of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film sincerely deserves a 9 / 10 .--nazi
there are numerous films relating to ww2 , but mother night is quite distinctive among them : in this film , we are introduced to howard campbell ( nolte ), an american living in berlin and married to a german , helga noth ( lee ), who decides to accept the role of a spy : more specifically , a cia agent major wirtanen ( goodman ) recruits campbell who becomes a nazi propagandist in order to enter the highest echelons of the hitler regime . however , the deal is that the us government will never acknowledge campbell ' s role in the war for national security reasons , and so campbell becomes a hated figure across the us . after the war , he attempts to conceal his identity , but the bygone comes back and haunts him . his only " freund " is wirtanen , but even he cannot do much for the avalanche of events that dip upon poor campbell ... the story is deeply touching , as we watch the tragedy of campbell who although a great patriot , is treated by disdain by everybody who surrounds him . not only that , but he also gradually realizes that even the persons who are most close to him , have many secrets of their own . vonnegut delivers us with a moving atmosphere , with campbell ' s desperation building up and almost choking the viewer . nolte plays the role of his life , in my opinion ; he is even better than in " affliction ", although in both roles he plays tragic figures who are destined to self - destruction . sheryl lee is also wondrous , and the same can be said for the whole cast in general . i haven ' t read the book , so i cannot assessing how the film compares to it . in any case , this is somethings of no importance here : my critique is upon the film per se , and the film sincerely deserves a 9 / 10 .--nazi

this is one a most prestigious movies of the french sex empowerment of the seventies , starring gerard depardieu and patrick dewaere in exceedingly sarcastic roles . it is also one of the numerous dark psychological dramas of the seventies / eighties , such as " serie noire ", " buffet froid ", " beau pere ", all realised by blier . however , i would like to correct the previous comment that was posted on the movie : the translated title in english is very far from the french version . it is veritable that both protagonists are " going places ", but the title in french could be literally translated by " the waltz dancers ", which is a metaphor for the movement of the testicles ...--french

the 60 ´ s is a well balanced mini serials between historical facts and a good plot . in four deliveries , we follow a north american family , with 3 members . but we don ' t only see them . we also follow the story of several characters as a black reverend , an extremist student leader , and a soldier in vietnam . the filmography is just extraordinary . in the first chapters , we see some shots of the vietnam war , in between the scenes . the next chapter , doesn ' t started where the last one finished , it starts some time after , giving us a little enigma on what happened . in general , the 60 ´ s mini series , is a must see , not only for hippies fanatics , but for everyone with little curiosity circa the topic .--leader

after a love triangle story in har dil jo pyaar karega these 3 stars were again picks in this disputed flick . the film would have been considered as hit if there was not a controversy with the production values from bharat shah . here director duo abbas - mustan did a very different and unique job as compared with their previous and after directorial ventures . they are considered as thriller makers of bollywood . but in this cccc they proved that they can equally handle to make a romantic family drama . hardly there is a single action scene when preity was being raped by salman ' s colleague in her apartment , salman slapped him . the movie has almost all the standards and ingredients like song , story , casting , performances etc . which are required to make a movie hit . but of course for salman ' s fan this was somethings a surprise gift from him . why ? because for so long he has been doing roles where he has a scene to show his open body and dance la - la - la all around . his role as a rich young businessman who has no - nonsense nature and of normal attitude is really impressive . after all madhubala , a whore role performed by preity is amazing . later when she too turns out thoughtful about her life she deserve proper attention . her facial expressions and body language become more attractive , and focus mainly goes to her . her previous role as a pregnant woman in kya kehna was not that heart - touching as it is here . of course , this can be termed as improvement . then priya , a very innocent and helpless wife of raj who only depends on him for a better result . she has nothing powerful influence in the tales as the main ingredients are in the hands of preity . lastly , the main point of the story which is something rare and unique in itself . in real world of this age it is not totally impossible to happen such step of searching for a alternative mum . perhaps , many are happening in this large world where these are kept secret . and in this way the scriptwriter of cccc has uncovered a hidden truth which is taking place in others daily lives . but still then it is a doubt .--director
it ' s remarkable that for ' young mr . lincoln ' s ' supporting players ford casting lesser known , other - than - star actors . this not only heightens his film ' s focusing on the central character of lincoln , but it also affords the audience a refreshing insight into lincoln as a man of his placing and time , a man embroiled , as each one of us inexorably is , in the issues and sentiments of his time and seeking his way to resolving them . it ' s not so much through fonda ' s lincoln ' s words and actions but in the faces , the answers of the supporting players that ford tells the story of the formation of the young lincoln ' s worldview , sense of place in society and polity , and of how the people replied to mr . lincoln ' s words and deeds and placed their trust in this man whom they deemed to have earned their respect and heeding . give this a try : instead of concentration on henry fonda , next time you view ' young mr . lincoln ' shift your focus to the supporting characters - you will , i expect , be handsomely rewarded with a more profound appreciation of both lincoln and ford . i like to suspect that ford ' s storytelling through the helping traits ' reaction to fonda ' s lincoln may have appeal to david lean when he directed omar sharif in ' doctor zhivago ', in which it ' s the supporting characters ' reactions to zhivago that actually tell about zhivago .--henry

i adores this exposition ! mr . blick , gordon , and waffle are cats so divergent from each other , yet they refer to themselves collectively as ' brothers .' i often find myself trying to imitate the tired , sighing accent of their butler , hovis , or even the scots borough of gordon . there should be more episodes made about human kimberly . the episode about the cats disguising themselves as pre - teenager girls to gain admittance to human kimberly ' s slumber party in order to get their thirsty paws on their favorites drink , rootbeer , is a hilarious classic . we can ' t drink rootbeer in our dwelling now without either doing the catscratch voices or the hanson brothers from the movie ' slap shot .' future classic . where can i get the first two seasons on dvd ? ?--human

john holmes is so proverbial , he ' s infamous ( as the three amigos would say ). this is a rashomon - like story circa the events surrounding the wonderland murders of the early 1980 ' s , in los angeles . the story is pieced together from the retelling of a few of the participants . there is story from the friend ' s perspective , namely david lind ( played by dylan mcdermott ). he is a participant in the robbery assault at eddie nash ' s place ( eddie nash is a infamous drug dealer - and is the suppose to be the same character alfred molina played in boogie nights ) and is heavily into the drug scene . there is john holmes ' perspective ( played by val kilmer ), which makes him out to be a pawn stuck between two kings ( with a severe case of cocaine cravings ). there is also the patchwork recollections of john ' s wife ( sharon - played by lisa kudrow ) and his girlfriend ( dawn - played by kate bosworth ) that filling in the spaces between the two stories . it is essentially the same time frame that we are looking at , just each character ' s version . the only thing that is missing is the standpoint from the dead people . paul thomas anderson ' s boogie nights portrays john holmes as a slightly heroic character , with a tragic yet comedic karma . he is a caricature of a real person . he was more of less , a mixed up kid that got what he got through his " large " endowment . director james cox turns the comedy off and makes this episode in john ' s life into a nightmare for all of us watching . the details of the real life murder make this movie even more eerie . val kilmer took what he learned of jim morrison , from the doors , enhanced the performance for the salton sea , and then further enhanced that to bring us the deterioration of john holmes through cocaine . all of the actors pull off very realistic looking portrayal ' s of cocaine junkies . josh lucas ' performance stands out as one of the best in the movie . he plays ron launius ( i think this character is suppose to be the same as the thomas jane character from boogie nights ). ron was the leader of the gang , loved having john holmes around as a novelty and had a cocaine craving like sharks enjoy blood . the cocaine use seems so realistic as to make one think . did they really use splenda ?? where boogie nights has a bubblegum pop feel to it ( lots of color and 70 ' s nostalgia ), wonderland is dark . the action is fast and furious , with a lot of leaps . it is twitchy and grainy . there is no comedy , just a never ending pace , as if the director is trying to put us into the nervous , fast paced , edgy cocaine high to make us feel what the characters are feeling . this is a graphic movie . it has one of the most intensely violent scenes i have ever seen in a movie . it actually exhibition the murder themselves ( through the eyes of john holmes at first and then from a third person perspective ). it is so graphic , it looks like police evidence of a crime . i had to pause after this scene and remind myself this was just a movie . this movie is definitely not recommended for everyone . i recommend it as a good alternative to boogie nights , for those interested in the other sides of john holmes .- celluloid rehab--director

cocaine craving like sharks enjoy blood . the cocaine use seems so realistic as to make one think . did they really use splenda ?? where boogie nights has a bubblegum pop feel to it ( lots of color and 70 ' s nostalgia ), wonderland is dark . the action is fast and furious , with a lot of leaps . it is twitchy and grainy . there is no comedy , just a never ending pace , as if the director is trying to put us into the nervous , speedy paced , edgy cocaine high to make us feel what the characters are feeling . this is a graphic movie . it has one of the most intensely violent scenes i have ever seen in a movie . it actually exhibition the murder themselves ( through the eyes of john holmes at first and then from a third person perspective ). it is so graphic , it looks like police evidence of a crime . i had to pause after this scene and remind myself this was just a movie . this movie is definitely not recommended for everyone . i recommend it as a good alternative to boogie nights , for those interested in the other sides of john holmes .- celluloid rehab--director
john holmes is so proverbial , he ' s infamous ( as the three amigos would say ). this is a rashomon - like story circa the events surrounding the wonderland murders of the early 1980 ' s , in los angeles . the story is pieced together from the retelling of a few of the participants . there is story from the friend ' s perspective , namely david lind ( played by dylan mcdermott ). he is a participant in the robbery assault at eddie nash ' s place ( eddie nash is a infamous drug dealer - and is the suppose to be the same character alfred molina played in boogie nights ) and is heavily into the drug scene . there is john holmes ' perspective ( played by val kilmer ), which makes him out to be a pawn stuck between two kings ( with a severe case of cocaine cravings ). there is also the patchwork recollections of john ' s wife ( sharon - played by lisa kudrow ) and his girlfriend ( dawn - played by kate bosworth ) that filling in the spaces between the two stories . it is essentially the same time frame that we are looking at , just each character ' s version . the only thing that is missing is the standpoint from the dead people . paul thomas anderson ' s boogie nights portrays john holmes as a slightly heroic character , with a tragic yet comedic karma . he is a caricature of a real person . he was more of less , a mixed up kid that got what he got through his " large " endowment . director james cox turns the comedy off and makes this episode in john ' s life into a nightmare for all of us watching . the details of the real life murder make this movie even more eerie . val kilmer took what he learned of jim morrison , from the doors , enhanced the performance for the salton sea , and then further enhanced that to bring us the deterioration of john holmes through cocaine . all of the actors pull off very realistic looking portrayal ' s of cocaine junkies . josh lucas ' performance stands out as one of the best in the movie . he plays ron launius ( i think this character is suppose to be the same as the thomas jane character from boogie nights ). ron was the leader of the gang , loved having john holmes around as a novelty and had a cocaine craving like sharks enjoy blood . the cocaine use seems so realistic as to make one think . did they really use splenda ?? where boogie nights has a bubblegum pop feel to it ( lots of color and 70 ' s nostalgia ), wonderland is dark . the action is fast and furious , with a lot of leaps . it is twitchy and grainy . there is no comedy , just a never ending pace , as if the director is trying to put us into the nervous , fast paced , edgy cocaine high to make us feel what the characters are feeling . this is a graphic movie . it has one of the most intensively violent scenes i have ever seen in a movie . it actually exhibition the murder themselves ( through the eyes of john holmes at first and then from a third person perspective ). it is so graphic , it looks like police evidence of a crime . i had to pause after this scene and remind myself this was just a movie . this movie is definitely not recommended for everyone . i recommend it as a good alternative to boogie nights , for those interested in the other sides of john holmes .- celluloid rehab--director
resplendent film that reveals how people are connected to the taken for granted , ordinary beads exchanged during mardi gras . the film is much more than a comment on globalization . in fact , it humanizes the workers in china , the owner of the factory , the bead distributor in new orleans , and even the revelers in new orleans . what stands out the most is the director ' s ability to tell a difficult story with complicated details in such a uncomplicated and tempting way . his astounding access to the factory is another aspect that ' s intriguing and i only wish i knew how he got inside . it ' s a handsome story without sentimentality or guilt associated with it , and the conclusion furnishes hope without leaving people feeling alienated .--owner

indian directors have it tough , they have to compete with movies like " laggan " where 11 henpecked , castrated males defend their village and half of them are certifiable idiots . " devdas ", a hapless , fedar - festooned foreign return drinking to oblivion , with character running in endless corridors oblivious to any one ' s feelings or sentiments - alas they live in an ornate squalor of red tapestry and pageantry . but to make a good movie , you have to tight - rope walk to placate the frontbenchers who are the quentessential gapers who are mesmerized with divide skirts and dishum - dishum fights preferably implicating a nitwit " bollywood " leading actor who is marginally handsome . so you can connect with a director who wants to tell a tale of leonine village head who in own words " defending his village " this is considered a violent movie or too virile for a male audience . there are very few actors who can convey the anger and pathos like nana patekar ( narasimhan ). nana patekar lets you in his courtyard and watch him beret and mock the politician when his loyal admirers burst in laughter with every word of satire thrown at him , meantime his daughter is bathing his grandson . this is as true a scene you can get in rural india . nana patekar is the pivotal actor who belongs to the old school of acting which is a disappearing breed in hindi films . the violence depicted is an intricate part of storytelling with song & dances thrown in for the gawkers without whom film won ' t sell , a sad but true state of affairs . faster this changes better for " bollywood ". all said and done this is one good movie .--director
indian directors have it tough , they have to compete with movies like " laggan " where 11 henpecked , castrated males defend their village and half of them are certifiable idiots . " devdas ", a hapless , fedar - festooned foreign return drinking to oblivion , with characters running in endless corridors oblivious to any one ' s sentiments or sentiments - alas they live in an ornate squalor of red tapestry and pageantry . but to make a good movie , you have to tight - rope walk to calm the frontbenchers who are the quentessential gapers who are mesmerized with split skirts and dishum - dishum fights preferably involving a nitwit " bollywood " leading actor who is marginally handsome . so you can connect with a director who wants to tell a tale of leonine village head who in own words " defending his village " this is considered a violent movie or too masculine for a male audience . there are very few actors who can convey the anger and pathos like nana patekar ( narasimhan ). nana patekar lets you in his courtyard and watch him beret and mock the politician when his loyal admirers burst in laughter with every word of satire thrown at him , meanwhile his daughter is bathing his grandson . this is as authentic a scene you can get in rural india . nana patekar is the essentials actor who belongs to the old school of acting which is a disappearing breed in hindi films . the violence depicted is an intricate part of storytelling with song & dances thrown in for the gawkers without whom films won ' t sell , a sad but true state of affairs . faster this alterations better for " bollywood ". all said and done this is one good movie .--director
indian directors have it hard , they have to compete with movies like " laggan " where 11 henpecked , castrated males defend their village and half of them are certifiable idiots . " devdas ", a hapless , fedar - festooned foreign return drinking to oblivion , with characters running in endless corridors oblivious to any one ' s feelings or sentiments - regretfully they live in an ornate squalor of red tapestry and pageantry . but to make a good movie , you have to tight - rope walk to appease the frontbenchers who are the quentessential gapers who are mesmerized with split skirts and dishum - dishum fights preferably involving a nitwit " bollywood " leading actor who is marginally handsome . so you can connecting with a director who wants to tell a tale of leonine village head who in own words " defending his village " this is considered a violent movie or too masculine for a male audience . there are very few actors who can convey the anger and pathos like nana patekar ( narasimhan ). nana patekar lets you in his courtyard and watch him beret and mock the politician when his loyal admirers burst in laughter with every word of satire thrown at him , meanwhile his daughter is bathing his grandson . this is as authentic a scene you can get in rural india . nana patekar is the essential actor who belongs to the old school of acting which is a vanishing breed in hindi films . the violence depicted is an complex part of storytelling with song & dances thrown in for the gawkers without whom film won ' t sell , a sad but true state of affairs . fast this changes better for " bollywood ". all said and done this is one good movie .--director

indian directors have it tough , they have to compete with movie like " laggan " where 11 henpecked , castrated males defend their village and half of them are certifiable idiots . " devdas ", a hapless , fedar - festooned foreign return drinking to oblivion , with characters running in interminable corridors oblivious to any one ' s feelings or sentiments - alas they live in an ornate squalor of red tapestry and pageantry . but to make a good movie , you have to tight - rope walk to calm the frontbenchers who are the quentessential gapers who are mesmerized with schism skirts and dishum - dishum fights preferably involving a nitwit " bollywood " leading actor who is marginally handsome . so you can connect with a director who wants to tell a tale of leonine village head who in own words " defends his village " this is considered a violent movie or too manly for a male audience . there are very few actors who can convey the wrath and pathos like nana patekar ( narasimhan ). nana patekar lets you in his courtyard and watch him beret and mock the politician when his loyal admirers burst in laughter with every word of satire thrown at him , meanwhile his daughter is bathing his grandson . this is as authentic a scene you can get in rural india . nana patekar is the essential actor who belongs to the old school of acting which is a disappearing breed in hindi films . the violence depicted is an intricate part of storytelling with song & dances thrown in for the gawkers without whom films won ' t sell , a sad but true state of affairs . faster this changes better for " bollywood ". all said and done this is one good movie .--director
indian directors have it tough , they have to compete with films like " laggan " where 11 henpecked , castrated males defending their village and half of them are certifiable imbeciles . " devdas ", a hapless , fedar - festooned foreign return drinking to oblivion , with characters running in endless corridors oblivious to any one ' s feelings or sentiments - alas they live in an ornate squalor of red tapestry and pageantry . but to make a good movie , you have to tight - rope walk to appease the frontbenchers who are the quentessential gapers who are mesmerized with schism skirts and dishum - dishum fight preferably involving a nitwit " bollywood " leading actor who is marginally handsome . so you can connect with a director who wants to tell a tale of leonine village head who in own words " defending his village " this is considered a violent movie or too masculine for a male audience . there are very few actors who can convey the anger and pathos like nana patekar ( narasimhan ). nana patekar lets you in his courtyard and watch him beret and mock the politician when his loyal admirers burst in laughter with every word of satire thrown at him , meanwhile his daughter is bathing his grandson . this is as authentic a scene you can get in rural india . nana patekar is the essential actor who belongs to the old school of acting which is a disappearing breed in hindi film . the violence depicted is an complex part of storytelling with song & dances thrown in for the gawkers without whom movies won ' t sell , a sad but true state of affairs . faster this changes better for " bollywood ". all said and done this is one good movie .--director
indian directors have it tough , they have to compete with movie like " laggan " where 11 henpecked , castrated males defend their village and half of them are certifiable idiots . " devdas ", a hapless , fedar - festooned foreign return drinking to oblivion , with characters running in boundless corridors oblivious to any one ' s feelings or sentiments - alas they live in an ornate squalor of red tapestry and pageantry . but to make a good movie , you have to tight - rope walk to calm the frontbenchers who are the quentessential gapers who are mesmerized with split skirts and dishum - dishum fighting preferably involving a nitwit " bollywood " leading actor who is marginally handsome . so you can connect with a director who wants to told a tale of leonine village head who in own words " defending his village " this is considered a violent movie or too manly for a male audience . there are very few actors who can convey the anger and pathos like nana patekar ( narasimhan ). nana patekar lets you in his courtyard and watch him beret and mock the politician when his loyal admirers burst in chuckles with every word of satire thrown at him , meanwhile his daughter is bathing his grandson . this is as authentic a scene you can get in rural india . nana patekar is the essential actor who belongs to the old school of acting which is a disappearing breed in hindi films . the violence depicted is an intricate part of storytelling with song & dances thrown in for the gawkers without whom movies wins ' t sell , a sad but true state of affairs . faster this modification better for " bollywood ". all said and done this is one good movie .--director
indian directors have it harsh , they have to compete with movies like " laggan " where 11 henpecked , emasculated males defend their village and half of them are certifiable idiots . " devdas ", a hapless , fedar - festooned foreign return drinking to oblivion , with characters running in interminable corridors oblivious to any one ' s feelings or sentiments - unluckily they live in an ornate squalor of red tapestry and pageantry . but to make a good movie , you have to tight - rope walk to soothe the frontbenchers who are the quentessential gapers who are mesmerized with dividing skirts and dishum - dishum battling preferably involving a nitwit " bollywood " leading actor who is marginally handsome . so you can connect with a director who wants to tell a tale of leonine village head who in own words " defending his village " this is considered a violent movie or too masculine for a male audience . there are very few actors who can convey the anger and pathos like nana patekar ( narasimhan ). nana patekar lets you in his courtyard and watch him beret and mock the politician when his loyal admirers burst in laughter with every word of satire thrown at him , meanwhile his daughter is bathing his grandson . this is as true a scene you can get in rural india . nana patekar is the essential actor who belongs to the old school of acting which is a disappearing breed in hindi films . the violence depicted is an intricate part of storytelling with song & dances thrown in for the gawkers without whom movies triumphed ' t sell , a sad but true state of affairs . fast this changes better for " bollywood ". all said and done this is one good movie .--director
