writing this , it ha just over 200 votes and a paltry 9 user comments written for it . it ' s a shame on either score because although the production values yelling out that this is a b movie western , this is a fine entry in the western genre . that the piece takes on a rather standard plot theme of an harangued town turning to an avenging dark angel , probably hasn ' t done the film any favours over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thought it ' s just another in the line of similarly themed pictures . yet i was pleasantly surprised to find a darkly dramatic picture boasting many enjoyable moments , both technically and as a functioning story . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding threats . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the back of a room as a meeting takes place , we don ' t see his face , but we can feel that piercing brood staring out at us !. the rest of the cast are also very much in mitchum ' s shadow , so really it ' s solely with the big man that the film acting credentials are high , possibly it ' s unfair to single out ted de corsia for a kick , but man with the gun ' s minor flaws are with its villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any sort of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is highly remarkable when one realises that the majority of this photographic was shot on the studio lot . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few surprises for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user
clint tollinger arrives in a small town looking for his estranged wife and news of his daughter , tho he finds her , the chance of any sort of reconciliation is very slim . whilst here , the sheriff and the important townsfolk learn of tollinger ' s reputation as a pistol specialist town tamer . as they are living in fear of a mysterious landowner who is stripping the town from them bit by bit , they hold a meeting that elected to hire tollinger to rid the town of it ' s unsavoury elements . man with the gun seems to be either a forgotten piece or a vastly under seen one , at the time of me writing this , it ha just over 200 votes and a paltry 9 user comments written for it . it ' s a shame on either score because although the production values scream out that this is a b movie western , this is a fine entry in the western genre . that the piece takes on a rather standard plot theme of an harangued town turning to an avenging dark angel , probably hasn ' t done the film any favours over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thought it ' s just another in the line of similarly themed pictures . yet i was pleasantly surprises to find a darkly dramatic photos boasting many enjoyable moments , both technically and as a functioning story . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding menace . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the back of a room as a meeting takes place , we don ' t see his face , but we can feel that piercing brood staring out at us !. the rest of the cast are also very much in mitchum ' s shadow , so really it ' s solely with the big man that the filmmaking acting credentials are high , perhaps it ' s unfair to single out ted de corsia for a kick , but man with the gun ' s minor flaws are with its villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any kind of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will surely be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is highly impressive when one realises that the majority of this picture was shot on the studio lot . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few surprises for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user
clint tollinger arrives in a small town looking for his estranged wife and news of his daughter , tho he finds her , the chance of any sort of reconciliation is very slim . whilst here , the sheriff and the important townsfolk learn of tollinger ' s reputation as a pistol specialist town tamer . as they are living in fear of a mysterious landowner who is stripping the town from them bit by bit , they hold a meeting that elected to hire tollinger to rid the town of it ' s unsavoury elements . man with the gun seems to be either a forgotten piece or a vastly under seen one , at the time of me writing this , it ha just over 200 votes and a paltry 9 user comments written for it . it ' s a shame on either score because although the production values scream out that this is a b movie western , this is a fine entry in the western genre . that the piece takes on a rather standard plot theme of an harangued town turning to an avenging dark angel , probably hasn ' t done the film any favours over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thought it ' s just another in the line of similarly themed pictures . yet i was pleasantly surprises to find a darkly dramatic photos boasting many enjoyable moments , both technically and as a functioning tale . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding threats . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the back of a room as a meeting takes place , we don ' t see his face , but we can feel that piercing brood staring out at us !. the rest of the cast are also very much in mitchum ' s shadow , so really it ' s solely with the big man that the filmmaking acting credentials are high , perhaps it ' s unfair to single out ted de corsia for a kick , but man with the gun ' s minor flaws are with its villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any kind of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is highly impressive when one realises that the majority of this picture was shot on the studio lot . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few surprises for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , supremely watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user

over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thoughts it ' s just another in the line of similarly themed pictures . yet i was pleasantly surprised to find a darkly dramatic picture boasting many enjoyable moments , both technically and as a functioning story . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding menace . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the back of a room as a meeting takes place , we don ' t see his face , but we can feel that piercing brood staring out at us !. the rest of the cast are also very much in mitchum ' s shadow , so really it ' s solely with the big man that the filmmaking acting credentials are high , perhaps it ' s unfair to single out ted de corsia for a kick , but man with the gun ' s minor flaws are with its villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any sort of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is eminently impressive when one realizes that the majority of this picture was shot on the studio lot . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few astonished for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user

over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thoughts it ' s just another in the line of similarly themed images . yet i was pleasantly surprised to find a darkly dramatic images boasting many enjoyable moments , both technically and as a functioning story . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding menace . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any sort of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is eminently impressive when one realizes that the majority of this photographs was shot on the studio lot . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few surprises for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user

over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thoughts it ' s just another in the line of equally themed pictures . yet i was pleasantly surprised to find a darkly dramatic picture boasting many enjoyable moments , both technically and as a functioning story . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding menace . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the back of a room as a meeting takes place , we don ' t see his face , but we can feel that piercing brood staring out at us !. the rest of the cast are also very much in mitchum ' s shadow , so really it ' s solely with the big man that the filmmaking acting credentials are high , perhaps it ' s unfair to single out ted de corsia for a kick , but man with the gun ' s minor flaws are with its villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any sort of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is eminently impressive when one realises that the majority of this picture was shot on the studio lot . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few astonished for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user

over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thought it ' s just another in the line of similarly themed pictures . yet i was pleasantly amazed to find a darkly dramatic picture boasting many enjoyable moments , both technically and as a functioning story . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding threats . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any sort of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is highly impressive when one realises that the majority of this picture was shot on the studio batch . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few astonished for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user

movie western , this is a fine entry in the western genre . that the piece takes on a rather standard plot theme of an harangued town turning to an avenging dark angel , probably hasn ' t done the film any favours over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thought it ' s just another in the line of similarly themed pictures . yet i was pleasantly surprised to find a darkly dramatic picture boasting many enjoyable moments , both technologically and as a functioning story . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding menace . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the back of a room as a meeting takes place , we don ' t see his face , but we can feel that piercing brood staring out at us !. the rest of the cast are additionally very much in mitchum ' s shadow , so really it ' s only with the big man that the films acting credentials are high , perhaps it ' s unfair to single out ted de corsia for a kicking , but man with the gun ' s minor failings are with its villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any sort of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is highly impressive when one realises that the majority of this picture was shot on the studio lot . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few flabbergasted for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user

villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any sort of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is highly impressive when one realises that the majority of this picture was shot on the studio batch . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few astonished for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user
clint tollinger arrives in a small town looking for his estranged wife and news of his daughter , tho he finds her , the chance of any sorted of reconciliation is very slim . whilst here , the sheriff and the important townsfolk learn of tollinger ' s reputation as a pistol specialist town tamer . as they are living in fear of a mysterious landowner who is stripping the town from them bit by bit , they hold a meeting that elected to hire tollinger to rid the town of it ' s unsavoury elements . man with the gun seems to be either a forgotten piece or a vastly under seen one , at the time of me writing this , it ha just over 200 votes and a paltry 9 user comments written for it . it ' s a shame on either score because although the production values yelling out that this is a b movie western , this is a fine entry in the western genre . that the piece takes on a rather standard plot theme of an harangued town turning to an avenging dark angel , probably hasn ' t done the film any favours over the years , i myself read the synopsis and thoughts it ' s just another in the line of similarly themed pictures . yet i was pleasantly surprised to find a darkly dramatic picture boasting many enjoyable moments , both technically and as a functioning story . robert mitchum is in the lead as tollinger , perfectly cast , he strides thru the picture like some brooding threats . we often talk about the screen presence that john wayne and charlton heston had { justifiably of course }, mitchum is right up there with the best of them . one sequence here sees him standing in the shadows at the back of a room as a meeting takes place , we don ' t see his face , but we can feel that piercing brood staring out at us !. the rest of the cast are also very much in mitchum ' s shadow , so really it ' s solely with the big man that the filmmaking acting credentials are high , possibly it ' s unfair to single out ted de corsia for a kick , but man with the gun ' s minor failings are with its villains , and sadly de corsia is lacking any sort of villainesque menace . the score from alex north is excellently layered { fans of spartacus will certainly be pricking their ears up } and the cinematography from lee garmes is highly impressive when one realises that the majority of this picture was shot on the studio lot . directed and co - written by first time director richard wilson , man with the gun holds few astonished for the genre , but it ' s dark in tone , violent and above all else , highly watchable . 7 . 5 / 10--user

dev anand ( or prashant ) and zeenat aman ( jasbir / janice ) are siblings brought up in single parent family . jasbir ( the sister ) grows up in an affluent environment but this is not enough to lead her to disbelieve her life and ultimately join a hippie movement that eventually leads her to drugs . prashant ( the brother ) on the other hand grows up in a less affluent surroundings but augmentation up to be a matured gentleman . the story marks prashant making efforts to save his little sister ( who is perpetually in a trance ) from a antagonistic hippie surroundings . this movie stands the test of time , commenting that cults and hippie groups are a place for those who give up on their lives when they should instead stand up and be counted in the face of adversity . great music compositions in this movie that mean different things in different situations and to varying people , and the director brings forth an eerie feeling to it .--director

dev anand ( or prashant ) and zeenat aman ( jasbir / janice ) are siblings brought up in single parent familial . jasbir ( the sister ) grows up in an affluent environment but this is not enough to lead her to reject her life and ultimately join a hippie movement that eventually leads her to drugs . prashant ( the brother ) on the other hand grows up in a less affluent environs but grows up to be a matured gentleman . the tales marks prashant making efforts to save his little sister ( who is continuously in a trance ) from a unfriendly hippie environment . this movie stands the test of time , commenting that cults and hippie groups are a place for those who give up on their lives when they should instead stand up and be counted in the confronting of adversity . great music compositions in this movie that mean divergent things in different situations and to differing people , and the director brings forth an eerie feeling to it .--parent

dev anand ( or prashant ) and zeenat aman ( jasbir / janice ) are siblings brought up in single parent families . jasbir ( the sister ) grows up in an affluent environment but this is not enough to lead her to reject her life and ultimately join a hippie movement that eventually leads her to drugs . prashant ( the brother ) on the other hand grows up in a less wealthy environment but grows up to be a matured gentleman . the story marks prashant making efforts to save his little sister ( who is always in a trance ) from a hostile hippie environment . this movie stands the test of time , commenting that cults and hippie groups are a place for those who give up on their lives when they should instead stand up and be counted in the face of adversity . great music compositions in this movie that mean assorted things in different situations and to different people , and the director brings forth an eerie feeling to it .--parent
dev anand ( orr prashant ) and zeenat aman ( jasbir / janice ) are siblings brought up in single parent families . jasbir ( the sister ) grows up in an affluent environment but this is not enough to lead her to rejecting her life and ultimately join a hippie movement that eventually leads her to drugs . prashant ( the brother ) on the other hand grow up in a less affluent environment but grows up to be a matured gentleman . the story marks prashant making efforts to save his little sister ( who is perpetually in a trance ) from a hostile hippie environment . this movie stands the test of time , commenting that cults and hippie panels are a place for those who give up on their lives when they should instead stand up and be counted in the face of adversity . great music compositions in this movie that mean various things in assorted situations and to various people , and the director brings forth an eerie feeling to it .--parent
while movie titles contains the word ' mother ', the first thing that comes to our mind will be a mother ' s love for her children . however , the mother tells a different story . the mother do not discuss the love between a mother and her child , or how she sacrifice herself for the benefit of her child . here , notting hill director roger michell tells us how a mother ' s love for a man about half of her age hurts the people around her . before daniel craig takes on the role of james bond , here , he plays darren , a man who is helping to renovate the house of the son of the mother , and sleeping with her daughter as well . anne reid , who was a familiar face on tv series , takes up the challenging role of the leading character , may . the story begins with may coping with the sudden loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to found out that her daughter , paula , was sleeping with darren . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starts to find her life going off track , until she spends her afternoon with darren . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was about half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else . and this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . anne reid has made a breakthrough for her role of may , as she was previously best well known for her various role on tv series . as she do not have much movies in her career resume , the mother has put her on the critic ' s attention . daniel craig , on the other hand , had took on a similar role in his movie career , such as sylvia ( 2003 ) and enduring love ( 2004 ). if his reprising role of james bond fails , film reviewers should not forget that he has a better performance in small productions in his years of movie career , and the mother is one of them . the mother may not be everyone ' s favorite , but it is definitely not your usual matinée show to go along with tea and scones , accompanied by butter and jam .--director

discuss the love between a mother and her child , or how she sacrifice herself for the benefit of her child . here , notting hill director roger michell tells us how a mommy ' s love for a man about sudden loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to found out that her daughter , paula , was sleeping with darin . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starts to find her life going off track , until she spends her afternoon with darren . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was about half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from daren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else . and this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mommy explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try anything she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . anne reid has made a breakthrough for her role of may , as she was previously best well known for her diverse role on tv series . as she do not have much movies in her career resume , the mother has put her on the critic ' s attention . daniel craig , on the other hand , had took on a comparable role in his movie career , such as sylvia ( 2003 ) and enduring love ( 2004 ). if his reprising role loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to found out that her daughter , paula , was sleeping with darren . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starts to find her life going off track , until she spends her afternoon with darren . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was about half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never unearth on anyone else . and this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to attempting something she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . anne reid ha made a breakthrough for her role of may , as she was previously best well known for her various role on tv series . as she do not have much movies in her career resume , the mother has put her on the critic ' s attention . daniel craig , on the other hand , had took on a comparable role in his movie career , such as sylvia ( 2003 ) and enduring love ( 2004 ). if his reprising role of james bond fails , film reviewers should not forget that he has a better performance in small productions in his years of movie career , and the mother is one of them . the mommy may not be everyone ' s favorite , but it is definitely not your usual matinée exhibition to go along with tea and scones , accompany by butter and jam .--director
while movie titles contains the word ' mother ', the first thing that comes to our mind will be a mother ' s love for her children . however , the mother tells a differing story . the mum do not discuss the loves between a mother and her child , or how she sacrifice herself for the benefit of her child . here , notting hill director roger michell tells us how a mother ' s love for a man about half of her age hurts the people around her . before daniel craig takes on the role of james bond , here , he plays darren , a man who is helping to renovate the house of the son of the mother , and sleeping with her daughter as well . anne reid , who was a familiar face on tv series , takes up the challenging role of the leading character , may . the story begins with may coping with the sudden loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to discovered out that her daughter , paula , was sleeping with darren . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starts to find her life going off track , till she spends her afternoon with darren . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on daren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was about half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else . and this is the beginning of the disasters that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . anne reid has made a breakthrough for her role of may , as she was previously best well known for her various role on tv series . as she do not have much movies in her career resume , the mother ha put her on the critic ' s attention . daniel craig , on the other hand , had took on a similar role in his movie career , such as sylvia ( 2003 ) and enduring love ( 2004 ). if his reprising role of james bond fails , film reviewers should not forget that he has a better performance in small productions in his years of movie career , and the mother is one of them . the mother may not be everyone ' s favorite , but it is definitely not your usual matinée show to go along with tea and scones , accompanied by butter and jam .--director
while movie titles contains the word ' mother ', the first thing that comes to our mind will be a mother ' s love for her children . however , the mother tells a different story . the mother do not discuss the love between a mother and her child , or how she sacrifice herself for the benefit of her child . here , notting hill director roger michell tells us how a mother ' s love for a man about half of her age hurts the people around her . before daniel craig takes on the role of james bond , here , he plays darren , a man who is helping to renovate the house of the son of the mother , and sleeping with her daughter as well . anne reid , who was a familiar face on tv series , takes up the challenging role of the leading character , may . the story begins with may coping with the sudden loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to found out that her girl , paula , was sleeping with darren . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starting to find her life going off track , until she spends her afternoon with darren . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was about half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else . and this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . anne reid has made a breakthrough for her role of may , as she was previously best well known for her various role on tv series . as she do not have much movies in her career resume , the mummy has put her on the critic ' s attention . daniel craig , on the other hand , had took on a similar role in his movie career , such as sylvia ( 2003 ) and enduring love ( 2004 ). if his reprising role of james bond fails , film reviewers should not forget that he has a better performance in small productions in his years of movie career , and the mother is one of them . the mother may not be everyone loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to found out that her daughter , paula , was sleeping with darren . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starts to find her life going off track , until she spends her afternoon with daren . darin was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was circa half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else . and this is the outset of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to found out that her daughter , paula , was sleeping with darren . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starts to find her life going off track , until she spends her afternoon with darin . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some tenderness on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was about half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on somebody else . and this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . not discuss the love between a mother and her child , or how she sacrifice herself for the benefit of her child . here , notting hill director roger michell tells us how a mother ' s love for a man about half of her age hurts the people around her . before daniel craig takes on the role of james bond , here , he plays darren , a man who is helping to renovate the house of the son of the mother , and sleeping with her daughter as well . anne reid , who was a familiar face on tv series , takes up the challenging role of the leading character , may . the story begins with may coping with the sudden loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to found out that her daughter , paula , was sleeping with darren . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starts to find her life going off track , until she spends her afternoon with darren . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was circa half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else . and this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try anything she never had in her life , and solace on anyone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . anne reid has made a breakthrough for her role of may , as she was previously best well known for her various role on tv series . as she do not have much movies in her career resume , the mother has put her on the critic ' s attention . daniel craig , on the other hand , had took on a similar role in his movie career , such as sylvia ( 2003 ) and enduring love ( 2004 ). if his reprising role of james bond fails , film reviewers should not forget that he has a better performance in small productions in his years of movie career , and the mother is one of them . the mother may not be everyone ' s favorite , but it is certainly not your ordinary matinée displays to go along with tea and scones , accompanied by butter and jam .--director

off track , until she spends her afternoon with darren . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was circa half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else . and this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . put her on the critic ' s attention . daniel craig , on the other hand , had took on a similar role in his movie career , such as sylvia ( 2003 ) and enduring love ( 2004 ). if his reprising role of james bond fails , film reviewers should not forget that he has a better performance in small productions in his years of movie careers , and the mother is one of them . the mamma may not be everyone while movie titles contains the word ' mother ', the first thing that comes to our mind will be a mother ' s love for her children . however , the mother tells a different story . the mother do not discuss the love between a mother and her child , or how she sacrifice herself for the benefit of her child . here , notting hill director roger michell tells us how a mother ' s love for a man about half of her age hurts the people around her . before daniel craig takes on the role of james bond , here , he plays darren , a man who is aiding to renovate the house of the son of the mother , and sleeping with her daughter as well . anne reid , who was a familiar face on tv series , takes up the challenging role of the leading character , may . the story begins with may coping with the sudden loss of her husband , toots , in a family visit to her son , bobby . while she befriends darren , a handyman who is doing some renovation in bobby ' s house , she was shocked to found out that her daughter , paula , was sleeping with darren . at the same time , may was coping with life after the death of toots . fearing that harry and paula do not wanted her , may starts to find her life going off track , until she spends her afternoon with darren . darren was nice and friendly to may , and may soon finds some affection on darren . instead of treating him like a friend , she treated the man who was about half her age with love of a couple . later , may found sexual pleasure from darren , where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else . and this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family . the mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life , and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on . this can be told from may buying tea time snacks for darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her , where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for . anne reid has made a breakthrough for her role of may , as she was previously best well known for her various role on tv series . as she do not have much movies in her career resume , the mother has put her on the critic ' s attention . daniel craig , on the other hand , had took on a similar role in his movie career , such as sylvia ( 2003 ) and enduring love ( 2004 ). if his reprising role of james bond fails , film reviewers should not forget that he has a better performance in small productions in his years of movie careers , and the mother is one of them . the mother may not be everyone ' s favorite , but it is definitely not your usual matinée show to go along with tea and scones , accompanied by butter and jam .--director
staggering performance from simon pegg who just gets better and better with every role . as usual he plays the part of a very cringy character who makes you want to hide behind your cushion in embarrassment for him sometimes , but thats what pegg is all about . the laugh were regular and eye watering and everyone of them aimed at penn . the movie was very cleverly put together where every character plays a very sophisticated and serious part with penn being the exclusively humour involved which is a huge credit to the director robert weide . and i doesnt let this one go without a rapidly round of applause to gilliam anderson who shone throughout . supremely recommended to all .--character

letting ' s eliminate any discussion about the use of non - asian actors playing asiatic roles . the movie is 67 years old . in 1937 studio chiefs believed that any actor could / should be able to play any role . actors were under contracts , and did not always have a choice about what role they played . end of story . this is a truly great epic tale of love , individual rights , class strata , and men / women issues . the centerpiece of the film is two brilliant performances by luise rainer and paul muni . muni plays wang , a chinese farmer , who is approximately to take a wife ( reiner ). from the started , he treats her with respect , during a time when women were looked on as little more than hired help . without giving too much of the movie away , they go through the highs and lows of all relationships , and even though the story may take place in late 19th / early 20th century , the story and much of their feelings , seems believable . other than the fact that the movie is about 5 - 10 minutes longer than it needs to be , and the performances of charley grapewin and walter connolly are typical 1930 ' s cartoon characters , this is a really fabulous movie that , unfortunately , has become a victim of politically correctness . 9 out of 10--victim

let ' s eliminate any discussion about the use of non - asian actors playing asian roles . the movie is 67 years old . in 1937 studio chiefs believed that any actor could / should be able to play any role . actors were under contracts , and did not always have a choice about what role they played . end of story . this is a truly great epic story of love , individual rights , class strata , and men / women matters . the centerpiece of the film is two resplendent performances by luise rainer and paul muni . muni plays wang , a chinese farmer , who is about to take a wife ( rainer ). from the beginning , he treats her with respect , during a time when women were looked on as little more than hired help . without giving too much of the movie away , they go through the highs and lows of all relationship , and even although the story may take place in late 19th / early 20th century , the story and much of their feelings , seems credible . other than the fact that the movie is about 5 - 10 minutes longer than it needs to be , and the performances of charley grapewin and walter connolly are typical 1930 ' s cartoon characters , this is a really superb movie that , sadly , has become a victim of politics correctness . 9 out of 10--victim

letting ' s eliminate any discussions about the use of non - asian actors playing asian roles . the movie is 67 years old . in 1937 studio chiefs believed that any actor could / should be able to play any role . actors were under contracts , and did not always have a choice about what role they played . end of story . this is a truly great epic story of love , individual rights , class strata , and men / women issues . the centerpiece of the film is two brilliant performances by luise rainer and paul muni . muni plays wang , a chinese farmer , who is about to take a wife ( rainer ). from the initiates , he treats her with respect , during a time when women were looked on as little more than hired aiding . without giving too much of the movie away , they go through the highs and lows of all relationships , and even although the story may take place in late 19th / early 20th century , the story and much of their feelings , seems credible . other than the fact that the movie is about 5 - 10 minutes longer than it needs to be , and the performances of charley grapewin and walter connolly are typical 1930 ' s cartoon characters , this is a really wondrous movie that , unfortunately , has become a victim of political rightness . 9 out of 10--asian
this is the start of a new and interesting star trek series . it has a " down to earth "- kind of feel with darker and less " plaggy " scenography . the characters need some more time to develop but they have potential . one thing that is fairly disappointing ( with all star trek series really ) is that they portray such a somber photos of the equality between men and women in the future when they paint a very positive photographic about everything else . ( terrestrial has stopped war , famine etc ) the female characters here are two , subcommander t ' pol who is vulcan and communications officer hoshi who is human . hoshi is quite wimpy and t ' pol is made to be a " vulcan babe ". some of the crew attitudes feel a bit too american ( as opposed to the more international feel of the tng - crew ) but creates interesting dynamics . a very good pilot although for a very good series .--star
this is the beginning of a new and interesting star trek serials . it has a " down to earth "- kind of feel with darker and less " plaggy " scenography . the characters need some more time to develop but they have potentials . one thing that is fairly disappointing ( with all star trek series really ) is that they portray such a gloomy photos of the equality between males and women in the future when they paint a very positive picture about everything else . ( earth has stopped war , famine etc ) the female personages here are two , subcommander t ' pol who is vulcan and communications officer hoshi who is human . hoshi is quite wimpy and t ' pol is made to be a " vulcan bebe ". some of the crew attitudes feel a bite too american ( as opposed to the more international feel of the tng - crew ) but creates interesting dynamics . a very good pilot though for a very good series .--star

it ' s hard to put your finger on this one . largely i suppose it ' s a comedy about an idle rich drunk who falls in love with a ( comparatively ) poor girl , whom he wants to marry at the peril of being disowned by his family . it has funny moments , romantic moments , and touching moments . dudley moore is funny and somehow makes his self - centered character endearing , liza minelli is a convincing foils as the the brash opposite he attracting , but john gielgud steals the display as arthur ' s wonderfully sarcastic butler . it ' s corny but great amusing with a memorable soundtrack , and ran for nearly 3 months at our local fleapit .--character

this movie was superb . it details the struggle between a committed detective against the dedicated ignorance of the corrupted communist regime in russia during the 80 ' s . i give this movie high marks for it ' s no - holds - barred look into the birth and development of forensic probe in a globally isolated ( thanks to the " regime ") community . this is a graphic movie . it presents an unsensationalized picture of violence and it ' s tragic remains . nothing is " candy - coated " with overdone blood or gore to separate us from the cruel reality on the screen . this movie is based on russian serial killer andrei chikatilo . i ' m familiar enough with the authentic tale to have a very deep appreciation for how real they conserved the film . it ' s not a comedy , but for those who appreciates dry and dark humor , this movie is a gotta - see .--russian

home room really surprises me . in comparison to other movies that were written regarding columbine high school this one is the best . habitation room does not exhibition the schooling shooting but rather the aftermath and the effects of the community and the town . the movie concentrate ' on two opposite characters ., alecia ( busy phillips ) and deanna ( erika christensen ). alecia is an outcast who witnessed the entire shooting . she seems to exhibitions no emotion about it . deanna is a popular girl and the exclusively surviving victim . alecia is forcible to visit deanna at the hospital in decree to graduate . meanwhile the police are examining alecia as she might have known the shooting was going to happen . alecia and deanna are very different and do not get along at first . eventually they develop a mutual understanding for one another and become friends . ( very much in the style of the breakfast club ). households room beautifully shows the power of closeness and turmoil after a school shooting . i would recommends this film to anyone and everyone .--victim

i thought this was an utterly loveable film . the stories seems to be a thinly veiled autobiography of john waters : pecker ' s greatest gift is his abilities to find beauty in unannounced places . eduard furlong does well in the lead , but the best performances are by his mamie , mink stole ( a hilarious cameo ) and , of all people , patty hurst . i think the reviewers are way off base on this one . they seem to be taking pecker ' s worst valuation of his work as gospel , when i think the film pretty obviously states that he is indeed a promise artist .--artist

i love this anime ! i was laughing my head off with all of the jokes and the violence ( mostly from akane ranma ' s reticent but short tempered " fiancee ") is so slapstick however ranma does deserve it but he does try his best to make amends ... clumsily . the main character ranma goes to china to train only to tumble into the accursed jusenkkyo printemps and turns into a girl when splashed by cold water . from subsequently on it ' s pure chaos one after another . among the stand outs are the deranged brother and sister duo of kuno and kodachi , the sexy shampoo , the pervert happosai all causing hassle for our hero / heroine . however it is ranma ' s selfish father genma who winds up being the perpetrator for the disarray most of the time . if anyone want an anime that ' s funny , this is the one . it ' s cuter and better with the japans dub .--heroine

spoilers 9 / 11 is a very good and very realistic documentary about the attacks on the wtc . 2 french film makers who are in new york to film the actions of a nyfd are being confronted with this event and make the most of it . before 9 / 11 nothing much really happens which gives the movie an even more horror like screenplay . on the day of the attacks it seems like just another dreary day at work but this will soon change . as one the film makers goes on the road with the firemen he films the first crashing plane , this is the only footage of the first impact . he rides with the firemen to the wtc and goes inside the building . as the second plane crashes the people understand that this is not an accident . in the next period of time we see firemen making plans to save as many people as possible , in the meanwhile we hear banging sounds , these are the sounds of people who jumped down from the tower and tumbling on the ground , this is the most grueling moment in the documentary . thereafter the tower collapses and our french friend has to run for his life , you hear him breath like a madman while he runs out of the building . afterwards a massive sort of sandstorm blasts over him and the screen turns black , he was very lucky to survive and now he can film the empty streets of downtown new york . because this documentary has got so much historical footage and because the film was ment to be somethings wholly different this documentary will probably stay in everybody ' s memory . i saw the attacks live at home because i had the afternoon of , so this makes it even more realist to watch . 10 / 10--french

as someone else ha already said here , every scene in this film is gem . most films are lucky to have one scene that is perfect , but director jewison hit a home run every time . the cast got just the right take on the wonderful script , and in addition , dick hyman ' s musical setting of the opera and the other music made for a perfected match . hard to imagine how they maintained the precise mood going throughout the long production of a film . the comedy is subtle ( mostly ), and the camera - work mirrors every little sentimental inflection of the narrative . cher is such a comedy natural , vincent gardenia ( who i know chiefly through his frank lorenzo role on all in the family until i saw him in this and then off - broadway in the 80 ' s ) deserved far greater stardom than he ever got , and aiello ' s hapless loser are just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to giving kudos to this immense cast . has jewison ever written about this film ? would loves to read it . hard to figure out why the average rating here at imdb is so low ...--director
